Part_of_Speech: num	n3-nsuf	n4-nsuf-suf	n3-nsuf	n1-nsuf	pron-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf	n4-nsuf	n3	pref-v-vsuf	pron-nsuf	pref-adj	pron-nsuf	adj	v-vsuf	pref-v-suf

Primary_Text: Nagaħ ža riyrinč’inäy dowde dandir di ƛˤori boda yołƛin.
Translated_Text: "If you don't find it out, I will start a war against you."
Russian_Translation: Если ты не узнаешь об этом, я объявлю войну против тебя.
Part_of_Speech: adv	pron	pref-v-vsuf-vsuf	pron-nsuf	post	pron	n3	pref-v-vsuf	v-suf

Primary_Text: Xanä q’ʷaridno oqno wˤałer rˤoƛ’arzay q’ˤimkin rizirxo zownanu, t’ok’ow roda šebin koƛ’inč’ey.
Translated_Text: The king became sad and while he hung his head, he didn't lift it up again and didn't know what to do anymore.
Russian_Translation: Царь огорчился, не зная что делать, не поднимал даже голову, опущенную вниз.
Part_of_Speech: n1-nsuf	n3-suf	v-vsuf	adv-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf	n4-suf	pref-v-vsuf	v-vsuf-vsuf	adv	pref-v-vsuf	n4	v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Sida quł tusnaq’är žader q’ʷaridno yoqno xanes kid yayn, šebi roqnoƛin nesä bayan bisnosi, yiłä nełäz babiwƛ’or bayru q’ʷariłiłäy esin.
Translated_Text: One day, the sad princess came to the boy into the prison and when he wanted to know what had happened, she told about the sadness that came upon her father.
Russian_Translation: В один день к юноше в тюрьму опечаленная пришла дочь царя. Когда уточнил он, что случилось мол, она рассказала о том, какое горе настигло ее отца.
Part_of_Speech: num	n4-nsuf	n4-nsuf	n1-nsuf	n3-suf	pref-v-vsuf	n1-nsuf	n2	pref-v-vsuf	pron	pref-v-vsuf-suf	pron-nsuf	n3	pref-v-vsuf	pron-nsuf	pron-nsuf	n1-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf	n4-nsuf	v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Nełaq mi rasgi q’ʷarid yaqnoƛin, žoyä nełas rok’u čučzi royn.
Translated_Text: "Don't be sad at all about it!", he calmed her down.
Russian_Translation: Ты нисколько не грусти за это мол, юноша успокаивал ее.
Part_of_Speech: pron-nsuf	pron	adv	n3	pref-v-vsuf-suf	n1-nsuf	pron-nsuf	n4	comp	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Howt’ay yäk’irun, där moƛał rukaysƛin babiwqor eƛo mi, soderno kurno ƛ’ˤiyor nexƛ’oräy, geres hibos boq’ˤugani pu wˤałxor butin nexno raƛ’moƛxorgon šäšiƛin.
Translated_Text: "When you go again, tell your father that you have seen it in a dream: He shall throw it upward and when it comes down again, the iron stick's heavier side will turn downward and get stuck in the earth."
Russian_Translation: Как придешь отсюда, скажи отцу мол, что ты видела во сне, если железную палку бросить на верх и когда опуститься вниз, то тяжелая часть повернется книзу, даже может вонзиться в землю.
Part_of_Speech: adv	pref-v-vsuf	pron-nsuf	n2-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf-suf	n1-nsuf	v-vsuf	pron	adv-suf	v-vsuf	adv	v-vsuf	n4-nsuf	n3-nsuf	pref-adj-suf-suf	n3	adv-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf	v-vsuf	n4-nsuf-suf	v-suf

Primary_Text: Elayn k’oƛin yik’in neła hemedur där moƛał rukaysƛin, užä małiru šebin babiwq esin.
Translated_Text: So she ran away and told her father: "I have seem it in a dream!" and what the boy had explained to her.
Part_of_Speech: adv-nsuf-suf	v-vsuf	pref-v-vsuf	pron-nsuf	adv	pron-nsuf	n2-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf-suf	n1-nsuf	v-vsuf	n4	n1-nsuf	v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Xanä cuƛerno kurno boq’ˤugani puƛ’aza ža hibo raƛ’moƛxor šišinosi, kaɣatno caxno ent’aza boq’ˤiw, ent’aza kikiw yoł yedu hiboƛin xizo-q’ˤimer maduhalłiqozo xander begirno.
Translated_Text: The king threw the stick into the air and it got stuck in the earth with the heavy side, then he wrote a letter writing where the stick is heavy and where it is light, and sent the stick back to the king from the neighboring country.
Part_of_Speech: n1-nsuf	adv-suf	v-vsuf	pref-adj-suf-suf	n3-nsuf	pron	n3	n4-nsuf	v-vsuf	n2-suf	v-vsuf	adv-nsuf	pref-adj	adv-nsuf	adj	v	pron	n3-suf	adv	n4-nsuf-suf	n1-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Xizyogon hemesitow xanä begirno q’ˤano t’umi bayrno, howzałäy nasi guluči, nasi aqiw yałru biyrƛin.
Translated_Text: Then, that king had two pigeons be brought[ to him, saying]: "Find out, which is male and which is female!"
Part_of_Speech: adv	pron-suf	n1-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf	num	n3	pref-v-vsuf	pron-nsuf	pron	adj	pron	adj	v-vsuf	pref-v-suf

Primary_Text: Žigon xan q’ʷariłiłer egin.
Translated_Text: Again, the king was sad.
Part_of_Speech: adv	n1	n4-nsuf	v-vsuf

Primary_Text: K’oƛin yik’in žader kid ixiwt’a muši kurxo yičin.
Translated_Text: His daughter came running and moaned heavily at the boy.
Part_of_Speech: v-vsuf	pref-v-vsuf	n1-nsuf	n2	adj-suf	n3	v-vsuf	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Šebi roqno deber, tusnaq’ä yałru dikinwa necet’a ixiw muši kurxanuƛin, žoyä bayan bisnosi, neła hemedur q’ˤano t’umi bayräsi yoł, žedałäy nasi guluči, nasi aqiw bat’a boda koƛ’inč’ey ƛexasiƛin esin.
Translated_Text: "What happened to you? Even I, who I am in prison, don't moan so much!", the boy wanted to know, and she told him so: "Two pigeons were brought and it remains unknown how to distinguish which of them is male and which is female!"
Part_of_Speech: pron	pref-v-vsuf	pron-nsuf	n4-nsuf	v-vsuf	pron-suf-suf	adv-suf	adj	n3	v-vsuf-vsuf-suf	n1-nsuf	n3	pref-v-vsuf	pron-nsuf	adv	num	n3	pref-v-vsuf	v	pron-nsuf	pron	adj	pron	adj	n3	pref-v-vsuf	v-vsuf	v-vsuf-suf	v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Q’ʷarid boqa bayxozoce šebin anu žaƛin, kidbes žoyä rok’u ɣˤaɣˤu rizirno.
Translated_Text: "There is nothing to be sad about", the boy made the girl's heart happy.
Part_of_Speech: n3	pref-v-vsuf	pref-v-vsuf-vsuf	n4	v	pron-suf	n2-nsuf	n1-nsuf	n4	comp	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Howt’ay yäk’irun moƛał rukays därƛin eso nesiq, łˤora ɣudƛ’o q’ˤanon t’umibi quqan xecin žedar biša kurnosi, gulučini t’umi šet’u butix bäči, aqugani bišno łiyaceƛin.
Translated_Text: "When you go out, - I saw it in a dream -", he told him(?), "leave the two pigeons hungry for 3 days, then, after you throw food onto them, the male pigeon will turn around until the female pigeon has finished eating."
Part_of_Speech: adv	pref-v-vsuf	n2-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf	pron-nsuf-suf	v-vsuf	pron-nsuf	num	n4-nsuf	num-suf	n3-nsuf	adj-suf	v-vsuf	pron-nsuf	n4	v-vsuf	adj-suf	n3	adv	pref-v-vsuf	pref-v	adj-suf-suf	pref-v-vsuf	v-vsuf-suf

Primary_Text: Elay babiwderno yik’in, užä małiruxor, hemedurtow där moƛał rukaysƛin, neła esin.
Translated_Text: She went out and to her father, and told him, after what the boy had explained: "I saw it like this in a dream!"
Part_of_Speech: adv-nsuf	n1-nsuf-suf	pref-v-vsuf	n1-nsuf	v-vsuf-nsuf	adv-suf	pron-nsuf	n2-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf-suf	pron-nsuf	v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Xanä žedu t’umbi łˤora ɣudi quqan xecin rišerƛ’oräy, aqugani bišno łiyace gulučini t’umi šet’u butix bičin.
Translated_Text: The king left those pigeons hungry for three days, and when he fed them, the male one turned around until the female one had finished eating.
Part_of_Speech: n1-nsuf	pron	n3-nsuf	num	n4	adj-suf	v-vsuf	pref-v-vsuf-vsuf	adj-suf-suf	pref-v-vsuf	v-vsuf	adj-suf	n3	adv	pref-v-vsuf	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Xizyo gulučinin bišno.
Translated_Text: Afterwards the male one ate as well.
Part_of_Speech: adv	adj-suf-suf	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Nasi žedałäy guluči, nasi aqiw yałru biynosi, maduhalłiqozo xanƛ’or kaɣatno caxno, enda guluči, enda aqiwƛin nesiƛ’or hoz-hozu t’uman regirno.
Translated_Text: After he knew which of them is the male and which is the female one, he wrote a letter to the neighboring king, and sent the pigeons back seperately [indicating] on it "That one is male" and "That one is female".
Part_of_Speech: pron	pron-nsuf	adj	pron	adj	v-vsuf	pref-v-vsuf	n4-nsuf-suf	n1-nsuf	n2-suf	v-vsuf	pron	adj	pron	adj-suf	pron-nsuf	adv	n3-nsuf-suf	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Hudayƛ’aygon maduhalłiqozoni xanä begirno q’ˤano gulu bayrno nasi yizałäy ʕoloqanaw, nasi ečru yałru bat’a boda koƛ’inč’inäy, di dowde dandir ƛˤori boda yołƛin.
Translated_Text: On the next day, the neighboring king had two horses be brought to him, [saying:] "If you don't know how to find out which of them is young and which is old, I will make war on you!"
Part_of_Speech: adv	n4-nsuf-suf-suf	n1-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf	num	n3	pref-v-vsuf	pron	pron-nsuf	adj	pron	adj	v-vsuf	n3	pref-v-vsuf	v-vsuf-vsuf	pron	pron-nsuf	post	n3	pref-v-vsuf	v-suf

Primary_Text: Xanƛ’o reže ɣudi zown, roda šebin koƛ’inč’ey.
Translated_Text: It was a big hazzle for the king and he didn't know what to do.
Part_of_Speech: n1-nsuf	pref-adj	n4	v-vsuf	pref-v-vsuf	n4	v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Babiwƛ’ nediw ɣudi rukayzaƛ’, kid žigon yizin žader tusnaq’ärno yik’in akixor yaynosi, ixiw muši kurno.
Translated_Text: When she saw the hazzle on her father, the girl got up again and went into the prison to the boy, and moaned, when she came to the window.
Part_of_Speech: n1-nsuf	pron	n4	pref-v-vsuf	n2	adv	pref-v-vsuf	n1-nsuf	n4-nsuf-suf	pref-v-vsuf	n4-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf	adj	n3	v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Žigon šebi roqnoƛin, užä bayan bisnosi, neła kinaw raqru šebin esin.
Translated_Text: When the boy asked: "What happened?" again, she told all the things that happened.
Part_of_Speech: adv	pron	pref-v-vsuf-suf	n1-nsuf	n3	pref-v-vsuf	pron-nsuf	adj	pref-v-vsuf	n4	v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Mi q’ʷarid yaqnoƛin, eƛin užä.
Translated_Text: "Don't be sad!", said the boy.
Part_of_Speech: pron	n3	pref-v-vsuf-suf	v-vsuf	n1-nsuf

Primary_Text: Howt’ay yäk’irun mi babiwqor där moƛał rukaysƛin eƛo, łˤora ɣudi žedu gulubi rišerłin, łi ħaƛurinč’eyn xecin, iħä łäƛ’or žedu rižinosi, ʕoloqanawni gulu łi ħaƛa boƛƛäɣor bäk’i, ečrunä lilyoxaytow ħaƛuƛin.
Translated_Text: "When you go, say to your father that I saw it in a dream: Although you feed those horses for three days, you don't give them water to drink, then you lead them over the water into a river; the young horse will go to the middle to drink water, the old one will drink from the riverbank instead."
Part_of_Speech: adv	pref-v-vsuf	pron	n1-nsuf	pron-nsuf	n2-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf-suf	v-vsuf	num	n4	pron	n3-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf-vsuf	n4	v-vsuf-vsuf-suf	v-vsuf	n3-nsuf	n4-nsuf	pron	pref-v-vsuf	adj-suf	n3	n4	v-vsuf	pref-adv-nsuf	pref-v	adj-suf-nsuf	n3-nsuf-suf	v-suf

Primary_Text: Elay yik’in kidbä, där hemedur moƛu yukaysƛin, babiwqor nesi užä äsiru łinałäyn eƛin.
Translated_Text: The girl went away and [saying] "I had a dream like this!", told to her father about what that boy had told.
Part_of_Speech: adv-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf	n2-nsuf	pron-nsuf	adv	n2	pref-v-vsuf-suf	n1-nsuf	pron	n1-nsuf	v-vsuf	pron-nsuf-suf	v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Xanä žedu gulubi łˤora ɣudi łi teƛinč’eyn rišerno łäƛ’or regirnosi, ʕoloqanawni gulu boƛƛäɣor bik’in, ečrunä lilyoxaytow ħaƛun neł qułtow žedu xizorno regirno, enda ečru, enda ʕoloqanaw yołƛin kaɣatno caxno.
Translated_Text: The king didn't give these horses water, but fed them for three days, then he let them onto the water and the young horse went into the middle and the old one drank from the riverbank; on that day, he sent them back, writing a letter[ stating]: "This one is old.", "This one is young."
Part_of_Speech: n1-nsuf	pron	n3-nsuf	num	n4	n4	v-vsuf-suf	pref-v-vsuf-vsuf	n4-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf	adj-suf	n3	pref-adv-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf	adj-suf-nsuf	n3-nsuf-suf	v-vsuf	pron	n4-nsuf-suf	pron	adv-suf	pref-v-vsuf	pron	adj	pron	adj	v-suf	n2-suf	v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Łˤono nesił adäza erno zawruni masala t’ubazi bodinosi, yeda xan askarno bižin nesi xanƛ’o iħanadanix ik’in.
Translated_Text: Having fulfilled the three tasks that were put before him, the other king led an army against this king to go fighting.
Part_of_Speech: num	pron-nsuf	post	v-vsuf	v-vsuf-suf	n3	comp	pref-v-vsuf	pron	n1	n3-suf	pref-v-vsuf	pron	n1-nsuf	v-deriv-nsuf	v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Žedu elozay bok’äłrungon, xanez kidbä k’oƛin yik’in tusnaq’ay maħor uži egirno.
Translated_Text: They escaped from there and the king's daughter ran and let the boy out of the prison.
Part_of_Speech: pron	adv-suf-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf-suf	n1-nsuf	n2-nsuf	v-vsuf	pref-v-vsuf	n4-nsuf	adv	n1	v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Tełäy aqrun, nesä šeƛ’un xiszi rodin, sis ganin biqirno, ozyoł xizay oqno.
Translated_Text: Having gotten out, he changed clothes, took a bull-calf and got behind the army.
Part_of_Speech: adv-nsuf	v-vsuf	pron-nsuf	n4-suf	comp	pref-v-vsuf	num	n3-suf	pref-v-vsuf	n4-nsuf	post	v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Ganƛ’on zown neširur yiził xizay yik’in, raładyoł taqˤorno boqa biynč’ey sidaɣ gogaƛ’ rešt’izi boqäsi besun.
Translated_Text: And on the bull-calf, he went behind them in the evening and found them taking a rest on a meadow somewhere, not knowing how to get over the sea.
Part_of_Speech: n3-nsuf-suf	v-vsuf	adv-nsuf	pron-nsuf	post	pref-v-vsuf	n3-nsuf	post-nsuf-suf	pref-v-vsuf	pref-v-vsuf	adv	n2-nsuf	comp	pref-v-vsuf	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Neširu xanä elo nasin sidaɣor butirnosi, xanä eƛin, di łi ħaƛuxosi t’akan sasaqor howt’or yayäru žek’ux kid yegira yołƛin.
Translated_Text: In the evening the king gather everyone together and said: "I will marry my daughter off to the man who can bring my water-drinking-glass here tomorrow!"
Part_of_Speech: adv	n1-nsuf	adv	adj	num-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf	n1-nsuf	v-vsuf	pron	n4	v-vsuf	n2	adv-nsuf	adv-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf	n1-nsuf	n2	pref-v-vsuf	v-suf

Primary_Text: Ža täqrun, ganƛ’on zown ik’in zawruni uži t’umin boqno, bik’in xanzo kidbez akix heqno.
Translated_Text: Having heard this, the boy, who was riding on the bull-calf, turned into a pigeon, flew away and sat down on the princess' window.
Part_of_Speech: pron	v-vsuf	n3-nsuf-suf	v-vsuf	v-vsuf	v-vsuf-suf	n1	n3-suf	pref-v-vsuf	pref-v-vsuf	n1-nsuf	n2-nsuf	n4-nsuf	v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Nełagon eniwqay izmun bisno, ža t’umi bexurač’inƛin nełqay rožin riqirno, akin raɣˤin tełxor begärun, bik’in kidbez q’ˤimƛ’o heqno.
Translated_Text: It [the pigeon] asked permission from the mother and took her word that she would never kill this pigeon; she opened the window and let it inside, and it flew in and sat down on the girl's head.
Part_of_Speech: pron-suf	n2-nsuf	n3-suf	pref-v-vsuf	pron	n3	pref-v-vsuf-suf	pron-nsuf	n4-suf	pref-v-vsuf	n4-suf	pref-v-vsuf	post-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf	pref-v-vsuf	n2-nsuf	n4-nsuf	v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Biqiranƛin neła reƛ’a regirnosigon, boxin elay ƛexeƛzo girimoƛ’no heqno žek’-bok’ełno mesedyos ħuli q’ˤidar bˤoƛ’urno.
Translated_Text: She tried to remove it with her hand and it flew away, sat down on a pole under a log, shook itself and made a golden feather fall down.
Part_of_Speech: pref-v-vsuf-suf	pron-nsuf	n4	pref-v-vsuf-suf	pref-v-vsuf	adv-nsuf	n2-nsuf-suf	n4-nsuf-suf	v-vsuf	v-vsuf	n3-nsuf	n3	adv-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Kidbägon elayn bisno neła nełaz pardagix bicin.
Translated_Text: The girl then went and took it and tied it to her own scarf.
Part_of_Speech: n2-nsuf-suf	adv-nsuf-vsuf	pref-v-vsuf	pron-nsuf	pron-nsuf	n4-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Xizyogon žek’-bok’ełnosi, nełłäy ukrus his yołäsi miƛ’i boqno.
Translated_Text: Then it shook itself again and he became a ram with silver whool.
Part_of_Speech: adv	v-vsuf	pron-nsuf	n3-nsuf	n4	v-vsuf	n3	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Miƛ’igon žek’-bok’ełno q’ˤidar his rˤoƛ’unosi, žan kidbä risno pardagix rutirno.
Translated_Text: The ram then shook itself and a piece of whool fell down; the girl took it and attached it to the scarf.
Part_of_Speech: n3-suf	v-vsuf	adv-nsuf	n4	pref-v-vsuf	pron-suf	n2-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf	n4-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: K’ox äƛirugon žek’-bok’ełnosi, užiƛ’or butin.
Translated_Text: When it shook itself a second time, it turned into the boy.
Part_of_Speech: adv	num-suf	v-vsuf	n1-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Xizyo nesä kinaw raqru šebinon esin, xaner nesäq nesä łi ħaƛuxosini t’akan yetinƛin esirno.
Translated_Text: Afterwards, he told everything that happened and the king asked for the water-drinking-glass that he wanted.
Part_of_Speech: adv	pron-nsuf	adj	pref-v-vsuf	pron	v-vsuf	n1-nsuf	pron-nsuf-nsuf	pron-nsuf	n4	v-vsuf-suf	n2	pref-v-vsuf-suf	v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Kidbä yisno mesedyosni t’akan teƛno.
Translated_Text: The girl took the golden glass and gave it to him.
Part_of_Speech: n2-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf	n3-nsuf-suf	n2	v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Žałäy t’umin boqno, kidbägon akin raɣˤin begirno.
Translated_Text: The boy became a pigeon again, and the girl opened the window and let it out.
Part_of_Speech: n1-nsuf	n3-suf	pref-v-vsuf	n2-nsuf-suf	n4-suf	pref-v-vsuf	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Neł t’umä ža t’akan yižin xaneł purłäzan eqerno, elaygon bitor hawaƛ’ žedu biħada bik’ixozo xanzo akixor bik’in.
Translated_Text: The pigeon carried this glass, put it next to the king and from there flew to the king's window, from which they went out to fight.
Russian_Translation: Этот голубь отвез тот стакан, поставил около царя, оттуда дальше пошел к окну царя, к которому они идут воевать.
Part_of_Speech: pron	n3-nsuf	pron	n2	pref-v-vsuf	n1-nsuf	n3-nsuf-suf	v-vsuf	adv-nsuf-suf	adv	n4-nsuf	pron	pref-v-vsuf	pref-v-vsuf	n1-nsuf	n4-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Elor baynosi, č’ikin boqno c’aramäz begin iduɣorno bik’in, žedus xabarno teqerno bičin.
Translated_Text: When it arrived there, it became a flea, went inside through a crack and listened to what they said.
Russian_Translation: Пришел туда, превратился в блоху, прошел через щель домой и слушал их разговор.
Part_of_Speech: adv-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf	n3-suf	pref-v-vsuf	n4-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf	adv-nsuf-suf	pref-v-vsuf	pron-nsuf	n3-suf	v-vsuf	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Bara xanqor hoboy eluƛ’or oz nexxowaƛin eƛinosi, nesä eƛin, nexłin žedur huni räynč’i.
Translated_Text: When the kings wife asked the king: "Is the army coming towards us now?", he said: "Although they will come, they won't know the way.
Russian_Translation: Когда жена сказала, теперь войско идет на нас мол, он проговорил, хотя придут они дорогу не узнают.
Part_of_Speech: n2-nsuf	n1-nsuf	adv	pron-nsuf	n4	v-vsuf-suf-suf	v-vsuf	pron-nsuf	v-vsuf	v-vsuf	pron-nsuf	n4	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Huni yoł ganƛ’on zown uži näxzaz regin.
Translated_Text: The way is going where the boy on the bull came from.
Russian_Translation: Дорога идет с той стороны, откуда шел юноша на быке.
Part_of_Speech: n4	v	n3-nsuf-suf	v-vsuf	n1	v-vsuf	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Hunin resun žedu nexłin, sadaq mesed gogaƛ’orno boɣno čuret’no bok’no nełas di nˤoƛu yadi.
Translated_Text: And even if they come, when they find the way, I will take away all the gold onto a meadow and with the beat of my whip, I'll transform it into ashes.
Russian_Translation: Хотя они найдут дорогу и придут, все золото вынесу на поле и ударом плетью я его превращу в золу.
Part_of_Speech: n4-suf	pref-v-vsuf	pron	v-vsuf	adj	n3	n2-nsuf-suf	pref-v-vsuf	n3-suf	pref-v-vsuf	pron-nsuf	pron	n2	pref-v

Primary_Text: Xizyogon kidbezno, debezno, däzno čuret’no bok’no, ħolaq’awt’a ʕomoybin rodin, ža čuret’ nˤoƛał buqˤan łärnokin bäsunč’iza.
Translated_Text: Then with the beats of our daughter's, your and my whip, we will turn into thin donkeys and hide the whip in the ashes where no one can find it.
Russian_Translation: Затем ударом плетью оберну дочери, тебя и себя в худощавых ослов и эту плеть спрячу в золе, где никто не найдет.
Part_of_Speech: adv	n2-nsuf-suf	pron-nsuf-suf	pron-nsuf-suf	n3-suf	pref-v-vsuf	adj-suf	n3-nsuf-suf	pref-v-vsuf	pron	n3	n2-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf	pron-nsuf-suf-suf	pref-v-vsuf-vsuf

Primary_Text: Xanes č’ortobi rukaynosi, xizo-q’ˤimer butin žedun bäk’iƛin.
Translated_Text: And when they see the king's clothes, they will go back again."
Russian_Translation: Увидев тряпки царя, они тоже обратно пойдут.
Part_of_Speech: n1-nsuf	n4-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf	adv	pref-v-vsuf	pron-suf	pref-v-suf

Primary_Text: Žeduq bexurno xabar łiynosi, c’aramałäz begin ža č’iki maħorno boqno, t’umƛ’orno butin boržizin boqno bik’in.
Translated_Text: After they finished talking, the flea went outside through a crack, turned into a pigeon again and flew away.
Russian_Translation: Как они закончили этот разговор, сквозь щель прошла блоха, превратилась в голубя, и полетел.
Part_of_Speech: pron-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf	n3	v-vsuf	n4-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf	pron	n3	adv-suf	pref-v-vsuf	n3-nsuf-suf	pref-v-vsuf	comp-suf	pref-v-vsuf	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Gogaƛ’or baynosi, užiƛ’orno butin, ik’in ozyode sadaq kecno ičin.
Translated_Text: When it arrived at the meadow, it became the boy again and went to sleep next to the army.
Russian_Translation: Когда прилетел на поле, превратился в юношу, пошел и лег спать вместе с войском.
Part_of_Speech: n2-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf	n1-nsuf-suf	pref-v-vsuf	v-vsuf	n4-nsuf	adv	v-vsuf	v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Xanes wazir č’ariłno puħo t’akan yukaynosi, nesis cim bizin, łu yedu mesedyos t’akan t’or yayrnoƛin.
Translated_Text: When the king's vizier woke up and saw the glass at his side, he became angry[ and asked]: "Who brought this golden glass here?"
Russian_Translation: Увидев рядом стакан, визирь царя проснулся и разозлился, кто этот стакан доставил сюда мол.
Part_of_Speech: n1-nsuf	n1	v-vsuf	post	n2	pref-v-vsuf	pron-nsuf	n3	pref-v-vsuf	pron	pron	n3-nsuf	n2	adv-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf-suf

Primary_Text: Elayn izin t’akanno yisno, et’un guluƛ’orno k’oƛin, elar bižin, t’ar bižin bigza ħalał žan akik’no, xizyo yižin xande t’akanno eqerno.
Translated_Text: He got up from there, took the glass and jumped onto a horse, lead it here and there, which tired him quite much, and then he carried the glass back and put it next to the king.
Russian_Translation: Оттуда встал, взял стакан, выпрыгнул на коня, туда повел, сюда повел, изрядно замотал его, потом отнес и поставил стакан возле царя.
Part_of_Speech: adv-nsuf-suf	v-vsuf	n2-suf	pref-v-vsuf	v-vsuf	n3-nsuf-suf	v-vsuf	adv-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf	adv	pref-v-vsuf	pref-adv-suf	adv	pron-suf	v-vsuf	adv	pref-v-vsuf	n1-nsuf	n2-suf	v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Moƛaxay izinosi, xan ħayran oqno ƛexun puħo t’akan yukaynosi.
Translated_Text: When the king got up from sleeping, he was surprised when he saw the glass at his side.
Russian_Translation: Царь встал и удивился, когда увидел возле себя стакан.
Part_of_Speech: n2-nsuf	v-vsuf	n1	comp	v-vsuf	v-vsuf	post	n2	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Žeduq neł gogaƛ’or baynč’ey łˤono bucin, łˤono ɣudin, łˤono saʕatno rik’äsi zown.
Translated_Text: They didn't come to that meadow for three months, three days and three hours.
Part_of_Speech: pron-nsuf	pron	n2-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf	num	n3-suf	num	n4-suf	num	n3-suf	pref-v-vsuf	v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Yedu t’akan łu t’or yayräƛin nesä bayan bisnosi, oƛixno k’oƛin nesistow wazirä di yowsƛin eƛin.
Translated_Text: When he wanted to know: "Who brought this glass here?", his vizier came running and said: "I brought it!"
Russian_Translation: Когда он уточнял, мол, кто доставил этот стакан, появился его же визирь и сказал, я принес мол.
Part_of_Speech: pron	n2	pron	adv-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf-suf	pron-nsuf	n3	pref-v-vsuf	v-vsuf	v-vsuf	pron-nsuf-suf	n1-nsuf	pron	pref-v-vsuf-suf	v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Nedur resunäyƛin, utin nesiƛ’ar xan debex di kid yegira yoł, amma ža t’akan mi yayrno yesunč’inäy, debi di meč’ beč’a yołƛin.
Translated_Text: "If that's the case", the king turned to him, "I will marry my daughter off to you, but if it's not the case that you brought the glass, I will cut off your head."
Russian_Translation: Если так, повернулся царь в его сторону, я выдам за тебя дочь, но если не ты принес этот стакан, я отрублю твою голову мол.
Part_of_Speech: adv	pref-v-vsuf-suf	v-vsuf	pron-nsuf	n1	pron-nsuf	pron	n2	pref-v-vsuf	v	conj	pron	n2	pron	pref-v-vsuf	pref-v-vsuf-vsuf	pron-nsuf	pron	n3	pref-v-vsuf	v-suf

Primary_Text: Sasaq bizinosi, ža uži ganƛ’on zown hunix oqno.
Translated_Text: The next morning, when he got up, the boy got on his way riding on the bull.
Russian_Translation: Когда встали утром, тот юноша сел на быка и отправился в путь.
Part_of_Speech: adv	pref-v-vsuf	pron	n1	n3-nsuf-suf	v-vsuf	n4-nsuf	v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Wazirzagon ozno boɣno nesił xizay bik’anƛin.
Translated_Text: The viziers led the army out and went to follow him.
Russian_Translation: Визири подняли войско и пошли за ним.
Part_of_Speech: n1-nsuf-nsuf-suf	n4-suf	pref-v-vsuf	pron-nsuf	post	pref-v-vsuf-suf

Primary_Text: T’azay nexxo oz rukaynosi, nesi xanä sadaq ukru-micxirno gogaƛ’or boɣno, čuret’no bok’no nˤoƛu yodin.
Translated_Text: When he saw that the army was coming from there, the king took away all his gold and silver onto the meadow, cracked his whip and turned it into ashes.
Russian_Translation: Царь увидел, что отсюда идет войско, и вынес на поле все драгоценности, ударил плеть и превратил в золу.
Part_of_Speech: adv-nsuf	v-vsuf	n4	pref-v-vsuf	pron	n1-nsuf	adj	n3-suf	n2-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf	n3-suf	pref-v-vsuf	n2	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Kidbezno, baruzno, nesizno bok’nosigon, žedułäy ħalaq’awt’a ʕomoybi roqno.
Translated_Text: And after cracking also [for?] his daughter, his wife and himself, they became thin donkeys.
Russian_Translation: Затем ударил дочери, жену, себя и превратил в худощавых ослов.
Part_of_Speech: n2-nsuf-suf	n2-nsuf-suf	pron-nsuf-suf	pref-v-vsuf-suf	pron-nsuf	adj-suf	n3-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Ža čuret’no nˤoƛał buqˤno.
Translated_Text: The whip he hid in the ashes.
Russian_Translation: Эту плеть спрятал в золе.
Part_of_Speech: pron	n3-suf	n2-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Elor bayrun xanes oz partalq’ay butiranił c’oxno.
Translated_Text: When the king's army arrived there, they started gathering the belongings.
Russian_Translation: Как пришли туда, царское войско приступило к сбору имущества.
Part_of_Speech: adv-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf	n1-nsuf	n4	n4-nsuf	pref-v-deriv-nsuf	v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Nesi užä yołi nˤoƛas ixinabi ric’no, ʕomoyƛ’no erno hunix oqno, dicegon žedu, ža nˤoƛugon łinar yižixƛin, nesiqor baƛ’ix bičiłin.
Translated_Text: The boy however filled his bags with ashes, put them onto the donkey and went on his way, although they were scolding him much: "Why are you carrying these ashes?!"
Russian_Translation: А этот юноша заполнил мешки золы, поставил их на ослов и шел по дороге, хотя они ругали его, зачем эту золу хоть забрать мол.
Part_of_Speech: pron	n1-nsuf	adv	n2-nsuf	n4-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf	n3-nsuf-suf	v-vsuf	n4-nsuf	v-vsuf	pron-suf	pron	pron	n2-suf	pron	pref-v-vsuf-suf	pron-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Xanän, nesis ozyon bisno bäziruce nesi xanes maʕišatno bown, xizo-q’ˤimer butin ʕaƛaɣor žedun nexno.
Translated_Text: The [other] king and his army took as much as they could get of this king's belongings and returned back into the village.
Russian_Translation: Царь и его войско взяли с собой имущество того царя столько, сколько смогли, и вернулись обратно в село.
Part_of_Speech: n1-nsuf-suf	pron-nsuf	n4-nsuf-suf	pref-v-vsuf	pref-v-vsuf-nsuf	pron	n1-nsuf	n3-suf	pref-v-vsuf	adv	pref-v-vsuf	n3-nsuf	pron-suf	v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Elogon xanä wazirbin butirno, sosigon łu yedu dey mesedyosni t’akan yayräƛin esirnosi, oƛixno hemesitow wazirä eƛin, di yayrinč’a žaƛin.
Translated_Text: There, the king gathered his viziers, and when he asked: "Who again brought this golden glass of mine?", that vizier appeared and said: "Haven't I brought it?"
Russian_Translation: Там тоже царь собрал визиров, еще раз спросил, кто привел этот мой золотой стакан мол, появился тот же самый визирь и сказал, я же принес его мол.
Part_of_Speech: adv-suf	n1-nsuf	n1-nsuf-suf	pref-v-vsuf	adv-suf	pron	pron	pron-nsuf	n3-nsuf-suf	n2	pref-v-vsuf-suf	v-vsuf	v-vsuf	pron-suf	n1-nsuf	v-vsuf	pron	pref-v-vsuf-suf	pron-suf

Primary_Text: Xizyo xanä kidbeq esirnosi, t’akanyoł xizay howda wazir idur ayäƛin, ža wazir aynč’u, enda aysƛin, ganƛ’o zowali uži ukarno.
Translated_Text: Then, when the king asked his daughter: "Did this vizier come home for the glass?", [she said:] "This vizier didn't come, he came!" and showed him the boy on the bull calf.
Russian_Translation: Затем царь спросил дочери, пришел ли этот визирь за стаканом. Он не подходил, а тот пришел, указала на юношу, который сидел на быке.
Part_of_Speech: adv	n1-nsuf	n2-nsuf	v-vsuf	n2-nsuf	post	pron	n1	adv-nsuf	v-vsuf-suf	pron	n1	v-vsuf	pron	v-vsuf-suf	n3-nsuf	v-vsuf	n1	v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Łina sipat-suratyoƛ’ ža ayäƛin babiya esirnosi, kidbä kinaw šebin esin, sosi t’umi bays, nełłäy žek’-bok’ełno ukrus his yołäsi miƛ’i boqsi, xizyo neł miƛ’iłäygon užin oqno t’akan esirnosi, teƛno din egirsiƛin.
Translated_Text: "What shape did he arrive in?", asked the father, and his daughter told him the entire thing: "At first, a pigeon came, the it shook itself and became a ram with silver whool, afterwards that ram became a boy again, asked for the glass; I gave him the glass and let him go."
Russian_Translation: Отец спросил, каким обликом он пришел мол, и девушка рассказала обо всем, сперва голубь пришел, он встряхнулся и превратился в барана с золотой шерстью, затем из этого баран обратился в юношу, спросил у меня стакан, а я дала и отправила.
Part_of_Speech: pron	n-nsuf	pron	v-vsuf-suf	n1-nsuf	v-vsuf	n2-nsuf	adj	n4	v-vsuf	adv	n3	pref-v-vsuf	pron-nsuf	v-vsuf	n3-nsuf	n4	v-vsuf	n3	pref-v-vsuf	adv	pron	n3-nsuf-suf	n1-suf	v-vsuf	n2	v-vsuf	v-vsuf	pron-suf	v-vsuf-suf

Primary_Text: Neła t’umiqay bˤaƛ’uru ħuli babiwz k’ukyoł boqun, miƛ’iłäy räšruni mesedyosnigon his ħamarno čˤaƛin esirno, baba, req’ezi roqxaƛin.
Translated_Text: She put the feather that fell from that pigeon onto her father's hat, and threw the golden whool that fell from the ram onto the chest and asked: "Daddy, does it fit?"
Russian_Translation: Перо, которое уронил голубь, вколола в шапку отца, а шерсть, которая повалилась с барана, бросил на грудь, и спросила, папа, подходит ли мол.
Part_of_Speech: pron	n3-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf	n3	n1-nsuf	n3-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf	n3-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf-suf	n3-nsuf-suf-suf	n4	n3-nsuf-suf	v-vsuf	v-vsuf	n1	comp	pref-v-vsuf-suf-suf

Primary_Text: C’aq’ req’ezi roqxo, dey kidƛin, babiyan žawab teƛno.
Translated_Text: "It fits very well, my daughter", answered the father.
Russian_Translation: Очень подходит, моя дочь мол, ответил отец.
Part_of_Speech: adv	comp	pref-v-vsuf	pron-nsuf	n2-suf	n1-nsuf-suf	n3	v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Xanä wazires meč’no beč’no, t’akan nesiqor yayäruni žax, ixiw bertenno bodin, kidno yegirno.
Translated_Text: The king cut off the vizier's head, arranged a big wedding and gave his daughter to the boy who brought him his glass.
Russian_Translation: Царь отсек голову визира, сыграл большую свадьбу и выдал дочь за того, кто нес ему стакан.
Part_of_Speech: n1-nsuf	n1-nsuf	n3-suf	pref-v-vsuf	n2	pron-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf-suf	n1-nsuf	adj	n3-suf	pref-v-vsuf	n2-suf	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Däzoq’aw ɣˤutkun rodoƛin, xanä eƛin kidbez xedyoqor, maday madargon mesedyos ƛen eroƛin.
Translated_Text: "Build a house like mine", said the king to his daughter's husband, "and construct a golden bridge from door to door!"
Russian_Translation: Царь сказал мужу дочери, построишь дом наподобие моего и со двора на двор установишь золотой мост.
Part_of_Speech: pron-suf-nsuf	n4-suf	pref-v-vsuf-suf	n1-nsuf	v-vsuf	n2-nsuf	n1-nsuf	n2-nsuf	n2-nsuf-suf	n3-nsuf	n3-suf	v-vsuf-suf

Primary_Text: Sasaqtow moƛaxay izizaƛ’or, nesä äƛiruxor rodäsi reže ɣˤutkun, nesiz maday kidbez madär kuräsi mesedyos ƛen bukayzaƛ’, xan haqan ogun ezun ƛexun.
Translated_Text: The next morning after getting up from sleeping, he built a big house as said, and when the king saw the golden bridge erected from his door to his daughter's door, he remained looking at it with an open mouth.
Russian_Translation: Царь удивился, когда завтра же утром, пока он не встал, увидел построивший большой дом, как он сказал, и протянутый золотой мост от его двора до двора дочери.
Part_of_Speech: adv-suf	n2-nsuf	v-vsuf	pron-nsuf	num-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf	pref-adj	n4-suf	pron-nsuf	n2-nsuf	n2-nsuf	n2-nsuf	v-vsuf	n3-nsuf	n3-suf	pref-v-vsuf	n1	n2-nsuf-suf	v-vsuf	v-vsuf	v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Mesedyoztow ƛäƛ’ kidbedäɣorgon ik’inosi, elo mesedyos ric’äsi istowli resun.
Translated_Text: When he went over the golden bridge to his daughter, he found a table filled with gold there.
Russian_Translation: По золотому же мосту пошел к дочери, там нашел стол полный золота.
Part_of_Speech: n3-nsuf-suf	n3-nsuf	n2-nsuf-suf	v-vsuf	adv	n3-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf	n4	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Ik’in yisä reƛ’a atinosi, mesed nˤoƛaƛ’or butin.
Translated_Text: When he went and touched it with his hand, the gold turned into ashes.
Russian_Translation: Когда он пошел и трогал рукой, золото превратилось в золу...
Part_of_Speech: v-vsuf	pron-nsuf	n4	v-vsuf	n3	n2-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Xizorgon roɣnosi, yałru mesed boqno.
Translated_Text: When he took it back, it turned back into the gold that it was.
Russian_Translation: убрал обратно, остался обычным золотом.
Part_of_Speech: adv-suf	pref-v-vsuf	v-vsuf	n3	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Xizyo xanä esirno žaq, nediw hunar yołäsi šida mi eni-babiya bazarganzar teƛno, žedagon där neƛaƛin.
Translated_Text: Afterwards, the king asked the boy: "Why did your parents gave you - who has such talents - to the merchants and they in turn gave you to me?"
Russian_Translation: Потом царь спросил юношу, ты такой талантливый, почему тебя продали купцам, а они дали мне мол.
Part_of_Speech: adv	n1-nsuf	v-vsuf	n1-nsuf	pron	n3	v-vsuf	pron	pron	n1pl-nsuf	n1-nsuf-nsuf	v-vsuf	pron-suf	pron-nsuf	v-vsuf-suf

Primary_Text: Užä eƛin, där howži roqxozo łinałäyn yukayru moƛu ya eni-babiwq, ya žedu bazarganzaq esinč’izaƛ’ žeda di teƛsiƛin.
Translated_Text: The boy said: "They gave me away, because I told neither my parents nor those merchants, that I had a dream in which I saw what would happen now."
Russian_Translation: Юноша сказал, меня они продали потому, что о сне, который я видел о том, что со мной должно было сейчас происходить, я не рассказал ни родителям, ни купцам.
Part_of_Speech: n1-nsuf	v-vsuf	pron-nsuf	adv	pref-v-vsuf	pron-nsuf-suf	pref-v-vsuf	n2	conj	n1pl-nsuf	conj	pron	n1-nsuf-nsuf	v-vsuf-vsuf	pron-nsuf	pron	v-vsuf-suf

Primary_Text: Žeduq ža moƛugon esis yołi, di yałruxor ƛexa zowsƛin.
Translated_Text: Had I told them this dream instead, I would have remained what I was.
Russian_Translation: Если бы рассказал им об этом сне, я бы остался таким же мол.
Part_of_Speech: pron-nsuf	pron	n2-suf	v-vsuf	adv	pron	v-vsuf-nsuf	v-vsuf	v-vsuf-suf

Primary_Text: Xanägon žas eni-babiw goƛ’a žek’un egirno, neł quł sasaqtow žedun bayrno.
Translated_Text: And the king then sent a man to call the boy's parents, and in the next morning, he brought them.
Russian_Translation: Царь отправил человека пригласить родителей юноши и привел их на следующий же день.
Part_of_Speech: n1-nsuf-suf	n1-nsuf	n1pl	v-vsuf	n1-suf	v-vsuf	pron	n4-nsuf	adv-suf	pron-suf	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Nełƛ’ay soder eniwn, babiwn žade paraxat bercinłiƛ’ xanzo ʕaƛa ʕumru bodix bičin.
Translated_Text: After that, the mother and the father lived beautifully and calmly in the village of the king, next to their son.
Russian_Translation: С тех пор мать и отец с сыном спокойно жили в царском селе.
Part_of_Speech: pron-nsuf	post	n2-suf	n1-suf	n1-nsuf	adv	n4-nsuf	n1-nsuf	n3-nsuf	n3	pref-v-vsuf	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: K’uruč’ k’eč’ ɣudi rocu, buq bay.
Translated_Text: All's well that end's well.
Russian_Translation: Куруч, бусинка, пусть проясняется день и восходит солнце.
Part_of_Speech: n	n4	n4	pref-v	n3	pref-v

Primary_Text: Esin šebi, xecin šebi sis zown q’ˤano halmaɣ.
Translated_Text: Once upon a time there were two friends.
Part_of_Speech: v-vsuf	pron	v-vsuf	pron	num	v-vsuf	num	n1

Primary_Text: Žedułäy sis zown igu, sis zown žuka.
Translated_Text: One of them was good, one of them was bad.
Part_of_Speech: pron-nsuf	num	v-vsuf	adj	num	v-vsuf	adj

Primary_Text: Sida quł žedu sadaq hunix bik’a keze boqno.
Translated_Text: One day they happened to go somewhere together.
Part_of_Speech: num	n4-nsuf	pron	adv	n4-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf	comp	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Hunix mekʷa c’oxnosi, žeda sosi iguni halmaɣes bišʷa rac’no łiyrno.
Translated_Text: When they became hungry on their way, the first ate up the good friend's food.
Part_of_Speech: n4-nsuf	n3	v-vsuf	pron-nsuf	adv	adj-suf	n1-nsuf	n4	pref-v-vsuf	v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Xizyo iguni halmaɣƛ’o mekʷan c’oxno, žukaniq bišʷan esirno, sosigon bišno žedu.
Translated_Text: Afterwards, the good friend got hungry and asked the bad one for food, and they ate first.
Part_of_Speech: adv	adj-suf	n1-nsuf	n3-suf	v-vsuf	adj-deriv-nsuf	n4-suf	v-vsuf	adv-suf	pref-v-vsuf	pron

Primary_Text: K’ox äƛirugon mekoyn iguni halmaɣä biša esirnosi, nesä inkar boyn, deber di sosi neƛinč’aƛin.
Translated_Text: When the good friend was hungry for the second time, he asked for food, but he [the other one] rejected: "Didn't I give you something first?"
Part_of_Speech: adv	num-suf	v-vsuf	adj-suf	n1-nsuf	n4	v-vsuf	pron-nsuf	n3	pref-v-vsuf	pron-nsuf	pron	adv	v-vsuf-suf-suf

Primary_Text: Xizyogon žukani halmaɣä eƛin, deber bišʷa retinäy, roɣno mi där sis ozuri neƛƛin.
Translated_Text: Then the bad friend said: "If you want food, take one eye out and give it to me!"
Part_of_Speech: adv	adj-deriv	n1-nsuf	v-vsuf	pron-nsuf	n4	pref-v-vsuf	pref-v-vsuf	pron	pron-nsuf	num	n4	v-suf

Primary_Text: Mekos nece ħal boqzaƛ’, roɣno ozuri teƛnosi dandi, žukani halmaɣä igunir rac’a biša teƛno.
Translated_Text: Because the hunger's strength got so big, he took away his eye and gave it to him, and the bad friend gave the good one food to eat, right away.
Part_of_Speech: n3-nsuf	adv	n3	pref-v-vsuf	pref-v-vsuf	n4	v-vsuf	adv	adj-deriv	n1-nsuf	adj-suf-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf	n4	v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Xizyogon mekʷa c’oxno iguni halmaɣä žukaniq bišʷa esirnosi, q’ˤano äƛirugon ozuri roɣno nesir teƛzaƛ’or išernoanu ža žukani halmaɣä.
Translated_Text: Again, the good friend became hungry and asked the bad one for food, and the bad friend didn't let him eat before he didn't take away his second eye and gave it to him.
Part_of_Speech: adv	n3	v-vsuf	adj-suf	n1-nsuf	adj-deriv-nsuf	n4	v-vsuf	num	num-suf	n4	pref-v-vsuf	pron-nsuf	v-vsuf	v-vsuf-vsuf-vsuf	pron	adj-deriv	n1-nsuf

Primary_Text: Hemedur q’ˤunan ozurazaƛ’ayn ok’ek’no iguni halmaɣ žukanä, howlotow žan xecin oxin nesidäy.
Translated_Text: So the bad one had stolen the two eyes from the the good friend, left him there and ran away from him.
Part_of_Speech: adv	num-suf	n4-nsuf-nsuf-suf	v-vsuf	adj-suf	n1	adj-vsuf-nsuf	adv-suf	pron-suf	v-vsuf	v-vsuf	pron-nsuf

Primary_Text: Hudun ža ozzatawni žek’u harihun ƛaƛaƛix ik’in, sidaɣ aɣˤuxor keze oqno.
Translated_Text: Nevertheless, this eyeless man went slowly feeling up and got to a mill someplace.
Part_of_Speech: adv	pron	n4-nsuf-nsuf-suf	n1	adv	v-vsuf	v-vsuf	adv	n2-nsuf	comp	v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Elor aynosi, mogolarno izin, kecno ičin.
Translated_Text: Having arrived there, he got into the granary and went to sleep.
Part_of_Speech: adv-nsuf	v-vsuf	n3-nsuf-suf	v-vsuf	v-vsuf	v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Hemeła qułtow mogolxo elo aɣˤuxor zeyn, zirun, boc’in rayn.
Translated_Text: The next day, a bear, a fox and a wolf came there to the mill at the granary.
Part_of_Speech: adv	n4-nsuf-suf	n3-nsuf	adv	n2-nsuf	n3-suf	n3-suf	n3-suf	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Zeyä žedaqor eƛin, hemeł beženi ʕaƛa łi anuƛax.
Translated_Text: The bear said to them: "It's said that there's no water in this big village.
Part_of_Speech: n3-nsuf	pron-nsuf	v-vsuf	pron	pref-adj-suf	n3-nsuf	n4	v-suf

Primary_Text: Elo ʕaƛoł roƛƛo ixiw naħuz ɣuna teł łi yołƛax.
Translated_Text: There's supposed to be water inside a big oak in the middle of the village.
Part_of_Speech: adv	n3-nsuf	pref-adv	adj	n2-nsuf	n4-nsuf	adv	n4	v-suf

Primary_Text: Elay ža maħor łi roƛäk’rur, žamaʕatyo ʕaƛos boƛƛik’u ric’q’i neƛxoƛax.
Translated_Text: They say that the assembly of the village would give half their wealth in order to get the water out there.
Part_of_Speech: adv-nsuf	pron	adv	n4	pref-v-vsuf-nsuf	n3-nsuf	n3-nsuf	pref-adj	n3	v-vsuf-suf

Primary_Text: Žaƛa šebiƛin, boc’ä eƛin, pulanaw xan untizi oqäsiƛax.
Translated_Text: How's that?", and the wolf said: "It's said that some king became sick."
Part_of_Speech: pron-nsuf	pron-suf	n3-nsuf	v-vsuf	adj	n1	comp	v-vsuf-suf

Primary_Text: Nesiztow bˤeƛ’eł yałru biƛurox aluk’ani bˤeƛ’q’ˤus reƛ rac’näy, ža xan saɣ oqxosi yałrułin xalq’imor riyxanu.
Translated_Text: When he eats the meat of a sheep from his flock, which is white on its belly, this king will be healed; but the people don't know this.
Part_of_Speech: pron-nsuf-suf	n3pl-nsuf	v-vsuf	n-nsuf	adj-suf	n3-nsuf	n4	pref-v-vsuf	pron	n1	comp	v-vsuf	v-vsuf-deriv-suf	n3-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf-vsuf

Primary_Text: Łemu boƛƛik’u ric’q’i xanqayn bäqiƛin.
Translated_Text: Otherwise, get half of the wealth from the king!"
Part_of_Speech: conj	pref-adj	n3	n1-nsuf-suf	pref-v-suf

Primary_Text: Žagon šebiƛin, zira eƛin.
Translated_Text: "How's that?", said the fox.
Part_of_Speech: pron-suf	pron-suf	n3-nsuf	v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Sisgon xalq’imor riyxanusi šebin, łiłiroƛ’ ƛ’iri sis ažo yoł.
Translated_Text: "One thing that the people don't know is that there's a tree above the ditch.
Part_of_Speech: num-suf	n3-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf	n4	n3-nsuf	post	num	n2	v

Primary_Text: Nełaq yoqäsi q’ˤano ƛˤeb yoł.
Translated_Text: There are two leaves growing on it.
Part_of_Speech: pron-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf	num	n2	v

Primary_Text: Becawni žek’a ža ozzaq yiħinäy, neła kanłi bayrxoƛax.
Translated_Text: If the blind man smears them onto his eyes, it brings back his eyesight.
Part_of_Speech: adj-suf	n1-nsuf	pron	n4-nsuf-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf	pron-nsuf	n3	pref-v-vsuf-suf

Primary_Text: Žeda bexurxozo xabaryoqor aħyan kurno aɣˤuz mogola tełerno oqno ozatawni žek’un ičäsi zown.
Translated_Text: After they finished talking(?), the blind man perked up his ears, got into the mill's granary and waited.
Part_of_Speech: pron-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf	n3-nsuf	n4-suf	v-vsuf	n2-nsuf	n3-nsuf	post-vsuf	v-vsuf	n4-nsuf-suf	n1-suf	v-vsuf	v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Zeyn, zirun, boc’in elo sasaqorno ričin, qˤašiƛ’aɣor roqno rik’in.
Translated_Text: The bear, the fox and the wolf waited there until the morning and when it got dawn, they went away.
Part_of_Speech: n3-suf	n3-suf	n3-suf	adv	adv-nsuf-suf	pref-v-vsuf	n-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Qˤašinosi ža žek’u izin mogolay q’ˤidarno oqno, harihun łiłiroxsi łiłiroxno ik’in, zira äƛiruni ɣun resurno.
Translated_Text: When it dawned, the man got up and down from the granary, and slowly went to the ditch's ditch(?) and found the tree the fox has talked about
Part_of_Speech: v-vsuf	pron	n1	v-vsuf	n3-nsuf	post-nsuf-suf	v-vsuf	adv	n3-nsuf-suf	n3-nsuf-suf	v-vsuf	n3-nsuf	v-vsuf-suf	n4	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Nełaqno izin reƛ’iqor yiqi yäqiru ƛˤeb ozqo yiħixt’a kurxo zown.
Translated_Text: He reached up with his hand and smeared a plucked leaf onto an eye, and threw it away.
Part_of_Speech: pron-nsuf-suf	v-vsuf	n4-nsuf	pref-v	pref-v-vsuf	n2	n4-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf-suf	v-vsuf	v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Zamanałäy yisiq ozzałer kanłi bayrxosi ƛˤeb yiqin.
Translated_Text: After a while, he picked up a leaf that brought back his eyesight to his eyes again.
Part_of_Speech: n3-nsuf	pron-nsuf	n4-nsuf-nsuf	n3	pref-v-vsuf	n2	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Sisgon ƛˤeb yet’urno yiħinosi, hoq’ˤonigon ozłer kanłi bayn.
Translated_Text: He pulled out a single leaf and after smearing it [onto his eye], the other eye got its eyesight back.
Part_of_Speech: num-suf	n2	pref-v-vsuf	pref-v-vsuf	adj-suf-suf	n4-nsuf	n3	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Q’ˤunan ozzar rukaynosi, aɣˤuxay bitor hunix oqno yeda zeyä äƛiruni hemeł ʕaƛaɣor.
Translated_Text: When both of his eyes saw again, he got on his way away from the mill to the village that the bear had talked about.
Part_of_Speech: num-suf	n4-nsuf-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf	n2-nsuf	adv	n4-nsuf	v-vsuf	pron	n3-nsuf	v-vsuf-suf	pron	n3-nsuf

Primary_Text: Elo yisä godek’anya q’ˤida bäčiru ʕoloqzaq łi esirnosi, sidä izin zok’är aqˤun kučin teƛƛ’oräy, nesä eƛin, eleley, yedu šebi šebin, insanä aqˤuyä łäz meča ħaƛuƛin, nediw šebin behizi raqinč’iƛin.
Translated_Text: There he asked a young person who sat at the village square for water, and one got up, pissed into a mug and gave it to him and he said: "Behold, what is this? A human is not allowed such a thing as to drink urine instead of water!"
Part_of_Speech: adv	pron-nsuf	n4-nsuf	adv	pref-v-vsuf	n1-nsuf-nsuf	n4	v-vsuf	num-nsuf	v-vsuf	n4-nsuf	n4-suf	v-suf	v-vsuf	pron-nsuf	v-vsuf	excl	pron	pron	n4	n1-nsuf	n4-suf	n4-nsuf	post	v-suf	pron	n4	comp	pref-v-vsuf-suf

Primary_Text: Hudu ela šebi rodan, t’o ʕaƛa t’ok’ow łin roqinč’inäy, elurno bac’adaw kikes łi räti riqinäyƛin, eƛin nesi žek’uqor žamaʕatyoz ʕoloqza.
Translated_Text: "So what shall we do? If there's no more water in the village here, we want water from a clean spring if we could get it.", said the young person to this man.
Part_of_Speech: excl	pron-nsuf	pron	pref-v-vsuf	adv	n3-nsuf	adv	n4-suf	pref-v-vsuf-vsuf	pron-nsuf-suf	adj	n3-nsuf	n4	pref-v	pref-v-vsuf-suf	v-vsuf	pron	n1-nsuf	n3-nsuf	n1-nsuf-nsuf

Primary_Text: Xizyo nesä žeduqor eƛin, howt’o ʕaƛa di łi roƛik’näy, šebi meža där baha boyxƛin.
Translated_Text: Afterwards he said to them: "If I pull out water here in the village, what price do you pay me?"
Part_of_Speech: adv	pron-nsuf	pron-nsuf	v-vsuf	adv	n3-nsuf	pron	n4	pref-v-vsuf	pron	pron-nsuf	pron-nsuf	n3	pref-v-vsuf-suf

Primary_Text: Žeda eƛin, ʕaƛos boƛik’u ric’q’i neƛa yołƛin.
Translated_Text: They said: "We will give [you] half the wealth of the village!"
Part_of_Speech: pron-nsuf	v-vsuf	n3-nsuf	n	n3	v-vsuf	v-suf

Primary_Text: Bik’i däqor ʕo risoƛin, eƛin nesi žek’a.
Translated_Text: "Go and get me an ax!", said the man.
Part_of_Speech: pref-v	pron-nsuf	n4	pref-v-vsuf-suf	v-vsuf	pron	n1-nsuf

Primary_Text: Howlotow boƛƛi godek’anyä zawru naħus nesä ʕon rok’-rok’no rečiw łi roƛik’no.
Translated_Text: Then he hit the oak in the middle of the village square with the ax and drew thick water out of it.
Part_of_Speech: adv-suf	pref-adv	n4-nsuf	v-vsuf	n2-nsuf	pron-nsuf	n4-suf	pref-v-vsuf	pref-adj	n4	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Xizyo nesir žamaʕatyo q’ut’oƛ’ req’un boƛik’u ric’q’i teƛno, bˤeƛ’no, ɣuron, žedaxorgon aħobin, ɣˤʷaybin, siršaɣˤʷade sadaqgon hokombin, roƛik’u partal-q’ayn, qˤičin, ƛ’irigon kumakyor xalq’in begirno nesiq, žan hunix egirno.
Translated_Text: Afterwards, the assembly gave him - according to the agreement - half their wealth, sheep, cows, shepherds and dogs for them, carriages together with horses along them, half the property, the harvest, and above that, they sent people to help him, and let him go his way.
Part_of_Speech: adv	pron-nsuf	n3-nsuf	n3-nsuf	adv	n	n3	v-vsuf	n3pl-suf	n4-suf	pron-nsuf-suf	n1-nsuf-suf	n3-nsuf-suf	n4-nsuf	adv-suf	n4-nsuf-suf	pref-adj	n4-suf	n4-suf	adv-suf	n3-nsuf	n3-suf	pref-v-vsuf	pron-nsuf	pron-suf	n4-nsuf	v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Elaygon bitor ža boc’ä äƛiruni untarawni xander ik’in.
Translated_Text: From there, he went away to the sick king that the wolf had told about.
Part_of_Speech: adv-nsuf-suf	adv	pron	n3-nsuf	v-vsuf-suf	adj-suf	n1-nsuf	v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Nesider aynosi yisi žek’a esirno nesiq, ha xan, šida kecno ičäsi mi, šebi roqno deberƛin.
Translated_Text: When the man arrived at his place, he asked him: "Hey king, why do you sleep, what happened to you?"
Part_of_Speech: pron-nsuf	v-vsuf	pron	n1-nsuf	v-vsuf	pron-nsuf	excl	n1	pron	v-vsuf	v-vsuf	pron	pron	pref-v-vsuf	pron-nsuf-suf

Primary_Text: Roƛxo deyƛin, eƛin xanä.
Translated_Text: "My ___ is sick", said the king.
Part_of_Speech: pref-v-vsuf	pron-nsuf-suf	v-vsuf	n1-nsuf

Primary_Text: Di saɣ oynäyƛin, eƛin nesi iguni žek’a, šebi baha mi där boyxƛin.
Translated_Text: "When I cure you," said the good man, "what price do you give me?"
Part_of_Speech: pron	comp	v-vsuf-suf	v-vsuf	pron	adj-suf	n1-nsuf	pron	n3	pron	pron-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf-suf

Primary_Text: Xanä urɣizikin oqxo ičinč’ey nesir žawab teƛno, boƛƛik’u dey ric’q’i neƛa yoł deberƛin.
Translated_Text: The king wasn't thinking and answered him: "I will give you half of my wealth!"
Part_of_Speech: n1-nsuf	comp-suf	v-vsuf	v-vsuf	pron-nsuf	n3	v-vsuf	pref-adj	pron-nsuf	n3	v-vsuf	v	pron-nsuf-suf

Primary_Text: Nedur resunäyƛin, eƛin nesi žek’a, sis žek’u egir debez bˤeƛ’łäy biƛurox aluk’ani bˤeƛ’q’ˤu bowanix.
Translated_Text: "If that's the case," said the man, "send a man to bring the sheep from your flock which is white on the belly!"
Part_of_Speech: adv	pref-v-vsuf-suf	v-vsuf	pron	n1-nsuf	num	n1	v	pron-nsuf	n3pl-nsuf	n-nsuf	adj-suf	n3	pref-v-deriv-nsuf

Primary_Text: Ħonƛ’ay ža bˤeƛ’q’ˤun bayrno, bexʷayn nełas reƛ xanqo rac’ernosi, ža saɣ oqno.
Translated_Text: That sheep was brought from the mountain, slaughtered and when he let the king eat its meat, he got cured.
Part_of_Speech: n2-nsuf	pron	n3-suf	pref-v-vsuf	pref-v-vsuf	pron-nsuf	n4	n1-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf-vsuf	pron	comp	v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Xande idur aynosi, nesir elo teł cemä ozzataw kid yukaynosi, iguni žek’a esirno, di nełaz ozzałer kanłi bayrnäy, šebi mi där baha neƛxoƛin.
Translated_Text: When he came to a house with the king and saw a blind girl in a corner inside there, the good man asked: "When I bring back her eyesight, what price do you give me?"
Part_of_Speech: n1-nsuf	adv-nsuf	v-vsuf	pron-nsuf	adv	adv	n3-nsuf	n4-nsuf-nsuf	n2	pref-v-vsuf	adj-suf	n1-nsuf	v-vsuf	pron	pron-nsuf	n4-nsuf-nsuf	n3	pref-v-vsuf	pron	pron	pron-nsuf	n3	v-vsuf-suf

Primary_Text: Yedu kid debex yegira yołƛin, eƛin xanä.
Translated_Text: "I will marry her off to you", said the king.
Part_of_Speech: pron	n2	pron-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf	v-suf	v-vsuf	n1-nsuf

Primary_Text: Howlotow ičin nesi žek’a čantay yisno q’ˤanon ƛˤeb xanez kidbez ozzaq yiħinosi, q’ˤunantow ozzałer kanłi bayn.
Translated_Text: The man sat there, took two leaves out of his pocket and when he smeared it onto her eyes, the light came back to her two eyes.
Part_of_Speech: adv-suf	v-vsuf	pron	n1-nsuf	n4-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf	num-suf	n2	n1-nsuf	n2-nsuf	n4-nsuf-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf	num-suf-suf	n4-nsuf-nsuf	n3	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Xanä nesix ixiw bertenno boyn kidno yegirno, boƛik’u nesis ric’q’in, ɣˤutkun, posun teƛno, howlotow xande puräza iguni žek’un ičin.
Translated_Text: The king organized a big marriage and married off his daughter, gave half his wealth, his house and cattle to him and the good man was to the king's side.
Part_of_Speech: n1-nsuf	pron-nsuf	adj	n3-suf	pref-v-vsuf	n2-suf	pref-v-vsuf	n	pron-nsuf	n3-suf	n4-suf	n4-suf	v-vsuf	adv-suf	n1-nsuf	n3-nsuf	adj-suf	n1-suf	v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Elon nesä ʕadada ičinč’ey tukambin raɣˤin, elo teł mecyaza mecyabin ħišin q’ˤaʕidaƛ’ elar-t’ar aħnayx ičix zown.
Translated_Text: And there, not without purpose, he opened some shops, locked his hands in his hands and proudly walked around in there.
Part_of_Speech: adv-suf	pron-nsuf	adv	v-vsuf	n-nsuf-suf	pref-v-vsuf	adv	adv	n-nsuf-nsuf	n-nsuf-suf	v-vsuf	n-nsuf	adv	v-vsuf	v-vsuf	v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Sida quł hemedur yałzay, där niga-ɣˤič’i neƛƛin, nesider esirnoyx ayn hič’č’a adäza nesis halmaɣłun zawruni žek’u.
Translated_Text: One day, when he was doing this, the man who used to be his best friend came begging him "Give me some fabric!".
Part_of_Speech: num	n4-nsuf	adv	v-vsuf	pron-nsuf	n4	v-suf	pron-nsuf	v-vsuf	v-vsuf	adv	adv	pron-nsuf	n1-nsuf	v-vsuf-suf	n1

Primary_Text: Nesä nesi esirnoyx ayruni žek’ur niga-ɣˤič’i teƛno.
Translated_Text: He gave the fabric to the man who came begging.
Part_of_Speech: pron-nsuf	pron	v-vsuf	v-vsuf-suf	n1-nsuf	n4	v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Xizyo nesä tukamƛ’ozoni žek’uq esirno, mi ozurabin roɣno ƛexun zowali žek’u anaƛin.
Translated_Text: Afterwards, he asked the man in the shop: "Weren't you the man whom I took the eyes away from?"
Part_of_Speech: adv	pron-nsuf	n-nsuf-nsuf-suf	n1-nsuf	v-vsuf	pron	n4-nsuf-suf	pref-v-vsuf	v-vsuf	v-vsuf	n1	v-vsuf-suf

Primary_Text: Yołƛin, žawab teƛno nesä esirnok’ur.
Translated_Text: "I am." he answered the beggar.
Part_of_Speech: v-suf	n3	v-vsuf	pron-nsuf	n1-nsuf

Primary_Text: Ozurabin roɣno, aɣˤʷarno ik’in, mogolarno izin ičinäy, hemediw maʕišat neƛxoƛin.
Translated_Text: After you took my eyes, I went into a mill and when I got up into the granary, I was given such a fortune.
Part_of_Speech: n4-nsuf-suf	pref-v-vsuf	n2-nsuf-suf	v-vsuf	n3-nsuf-suf	v-vsuf	v-vsuf	adj	n3	v-vsuf-suf

Primary_Text: Howlaytow aɣˤʷarno ik’in, nesä nesis ozurabin roɣno, mogolarno izin ičin.
Translated_Text: And so, from there he [the other guy] went into the mill, took his eyes out and got up into the granary.
Part_of_Speech: adv-suf	n2-nsuf-suf	v-vsuf	pron-nsuf	pron-nsuf	n4-nsuf-suf	pref-v-vsuf	n3-nsuf-suf	v-vsuf	v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Hudod elor zeyn, boc’in, zirun rayn.
Translated_Text: At night, the bear, the wolf and the fox came there.
Part_of_Speech: adv	adv-nsuf	n3-suf	n3-suf	n3-suf	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Elo žedas žedaƛ xabarno boqno zeyä eƛin, ħuł di eƛin zawruni ʕaƛa žaqˤuł łi roƛixnoƛin.
Translated_Text: There, they spoke with each other and the bear said: "Yesterday there appeared water in the village I had told you about."
Part_of_Speech: adv	pron-nsuf	pron-nsuf	n3-suf	pref-v-vsuf	n3-nsuf	v-vsuf	adv	pron	v-vsuf	v-vsuf-suf	n3-nsuf	adv	n4	pref-v-vsuf-suf

Primary_Text: Wallaƛin, eƛin boc’ä, howža xanez bˤeƛ’eł zawru biƛurox aluk’ani bˤeƛ’q’ˤu yaqˤułer narƛa bok’ełnoƛin.
Translated_Text: "I swear," said the wolf, "the sheep with the white belly which was among the flock of sheep of that king there escaped somewhere today."
Part_of_Speech: excl-suf	v-vsuf	n3-nsuf	pron	n1-nsuf	n3pl-nsuf	v-vsuf	n-nsuf	adj-suf	n3	adv-nsuf	pron-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf-suf

Primary_Text: Xizyogon zira eƛin, walla, howža di eƛix zowali łiłiroƛ’ozoni ɣunoqay yaqˤułer ƛˤebno yok’ek’no.
Translated_Text: Then the fox said: "By God, someone stole the leaf from the tree on that ditch I talked about.
Part_of_Speech: adv	n3-nsuf	v-vsuf	excl	pron	pron	v-vsuf	v-vsuf	n3-nsuf-nsuf-suf	n4-nsuf	adv-nsuf	n2-suf	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Howt’o aɣˤʷa teł žek’uyey zowsƛin.
Translated_Text: And there seemed to be a man inside this mill!"
Part_of_Speech: adv	n2-nsuf	post	n1-suf	v-vsuf-suf

Primary_Text: Šebiƛa žek’u t’o zown äsuƛin, žedus xabar boqnosi, zeyä eloza naysinan bezu-bˤoƛ’a ziru begirno.
Translated_Text: After saying "Someone has to find the man here!", the bear sent the fox to look everywhere there.
Part_of_Speech: pron-nsuf	n1	adv	v-vsuf	v-suf	pron-nsuf	n3	pref-v-vsuf	n3-nsuf	adv-suf	adv	pref-v-vsuf	n3	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Bizin aɣˤuz mogolar bezunosi, nełar elo žek’u esun.
Translated_Text: When he got up to look into the mill's granary, he found the man there.
Part_of_Speech: pref-v-vsuf	n2-nsuf	n3-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf	pron-nsuf	adv	n1	v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Suƛƛitow zira aħi boyn, haxar, et’o teł žek’u yołƛin.
Translated_Text: Immediately the fox raised an alarm: "Now, there is a man inside here!"
Part_of_Speech: adv-suf	n3-nsuf	n3	pref-v-vsuf	excl	adv	adv	n1	v-suf

Primary_Text: Nełaz aħimoxorgon rizin k’oƛin zeyän, boc’än ƛaħi-ogurno ža žukani žek’u exurno.
Translated_Text: On his alarm, the bear and the wolf jumped up, teared the bad man to pieces and killed him.
Part_of_Speech: pron-nsuf	n3-nsuf-nsuf-suf	pref-v-vsuf	v-vsuf	n3-nsuf-suf	n3-nsuf-suf	v-vsuf	pron	adj-deriv	n1	v-vsuf

Primary_Text: K’eneč’ k’eč’ ɣudi rocu.
Translated_Text: All's well that ends well.
Part_of_Speech: n2	n4	n4	pref-v

Primary_Text: Zownƛax zown anuƛax sis ečru ʕomoy.
Translated_Text: Once upon a time there was an old donkey.
Russian_Translation: Был, говорят, не был один старый осел.
Part_of_Speech: v-vsuf-suf	v-vsuf	v-suf	num	adj	n3

Primary_Text: Eƛni yayƛ’oräy, ža sida quł neła nełar ɣˤutku rodanix halmaɣłin k’eyn maħor boqno.
Translated_Text: When the winter was coming, he went outside and looked for friends to build a house for him.
Russian_Translation: Однажды перед наступлением зимы он вышел на улицу в поисках друзей, чтобы строить себе дом.
Part_of_Speech: n2	pref-v-vsuf	pron	num	n4-nsuf	pron-nsuf	pron-nsuf	n4	pref-v-deriv-nsuf	n4-suf	v-vsuf	adv	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Hunix bik’iƛ’oräy nełade dandir mamalay c’oxno.
Translated_Text: While going on his way, he met a rooster.
Russian_Translation: Когда шел по дороге, он встретил петуха.
Part_of_Speech: n4-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf	pron-nsuf	post	n3	v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Neła ʕomoyq harizi rodin, din sadaq bižoƛin.
Translated_Text: He asked the donkey: "Carry me with you!"
Russian_Translation: Он попросил осла, возьми меня с собой мол.
Part_of_Speech: pron-nsuf	n3-nsuf	comp	pref-v-vsuf	pron-suf	adv	pref-v-vsuf-suf

Primary_Text: ƛa huduƛin, ʕomoy mamalayn sadaq boɣno hunix boqno.
Translated_Text: "So let's go!", and the donkey took the rooster and went on the way.
Russian_Translation: Пошли тогда мол, осел взял с собой петуха и отправился в путь.
Part_of_Speech: excl	excl-suf	n3	n3-suf	adv	pref-v-vsuf	n4-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Xizyogon žedar hunix k’et’u keze boqno.
Translated_Text: Then they met a cat on their way.
Russian_Translation: Потом они по пути встретили кошку.
Part_of_Speech: adv	pron-nsuf	n4-nsuf	n3	comp	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Nełan hemedurtow harizi rodin žedaq, din bižo sadaqƛin.
Translated_Text: And he asked them likewise: "Carry me with you!"
Russian_Translation: Она также попросила их, возьмите меня тоже с собой мол.
Part_of_Speech: pron-nsuf-suf	adv-suf	comp	pref-v-vsuf	pron-nsuf	pron-suf	pref-v-vsuf	adv-suf

Primary_Text: Elaygon bitor žeda žedude sadaq hunix k’et’un boɣno.
Translated_Text: From there they took the cat with them further on their way.
Russian_Translation: Оттуда дальше по дороге с собой они взяли кошку.
Part_of_Speech: adv-nsuf-suf	adv	pron-nsuf	pron-nsuf	adv	n4-nsuf	n3-suf	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Dahawtow bitaɣor rik’inosi, yiził dandir meši c’oxno.
Translated_Text: After they went a little further, they met a calf.
Russian_Translation: Оттуда чуть дальше пошли, и они встретили теленка.
Part_of_Speech: adv-suf	n-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf	pron-nsuf	adv	n3	v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Žan hemedurtow ešurno yizä yiził, roqno elay bitor uynon sadaq rik’in.
Translated_Text: So they took him along with them as well and from there the four went further together.
Russian_Translation: Его тоже они взяли к себе и вместе вчетвером пошли оттуда дальше.
Part_of_Speech: pron-suf	adv-suf	v-vsuf	pron-nsuf	pron-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf	adv-nsuf	adv	num-suf	adv	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Hemedur uynon rok’uɣʷeymoƛ’ hunix rik’iƛ’oräy, žedar bexuräsi boc’i besun.
Translated_Text: So when the four of them went on their way happily, they found a wolf who was killed.
Russian_Translation: Вот так вчетвером по дороге шли они весело, и они нашли убитого волка.
Part_of_Speech: adv	num-suf	n4-nsuf	n4-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf	pron-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf	n3	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: ʕOmoyä łinax riyx yedu elur ħažat boqaniƛin, halmaɣłiqorno eƛin, neła nełaz gugyoƛ’orno bizirerno, elay bitor bižin.
Translated_Text: The donkey said to his friends: "How does one know [how] it can become useful for us.", had [the wolf] lifted on his back and carried it further.
Russian_Translation: Осел сказал друзьям, откуда знать, может быть, он нам пригодится мол, подняли на его спину и забрал оттуда дальше.
Part_of_Speech: n3-nsuf	pron	pref-v-vsuf	pron	pron-nsuf	n4	pref-v-deriv-suf	n4-nsuf-suf	v-vsuf	pron-nsuf	pron-nsuf	n2-nsuf-suf	pref-v-vsuf-vsuf	adv-nsuf	adv	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Yizi nasin sidaɣ aɣˤuxor rayn.
Translated_Text: They all came to a mill.
Russian_Translation: Все они пришли к одной мельнице.
Part_of_Speech: pron	adj	adv	n2-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Elo tełäzay zurmasno, q’ilisno sas teqxo zown.
Translated_Text: There they heard the noise of a zurna and a drum from inside.
Russian_Translation: Там изнутри они услышали звук зурны и барабана.
Part_of_Speech: adv	adv-nsuf	n3-nsuf-suf	n-nsuf-suf	n3	v-vsuf	v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Madaza bäxuruni boc’in xecin, žedu aɣˤʷaɣor roqno.
Translated_Text: They left the dead wolf outside and entered the mill.
Russian_Translation: Оставили на улице убитого волка, и они зашли на мельницу.
Part_of_Speech: n2-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf-suf	n3-suf	v-vsuf	pron	n2-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Elo yizar boc’as berten besun.
Translated_Text: There they found the wedding of wolves.
Russian_Translation: Они там нашли свадьбу волков.
Part_of_Speech: adv	pron-nsuf	n3pl-nsuf	n3	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Žedu ʕuraw ɣˤaɣˤu rizin ƛirbabi bayzaƛ’.
Translated_Text: They got very happy, when guests came.
Russian_Translation: Они очень обрадовались приходу гостей.
Part_of_Speech: pron	adv	comp	pref-v-vsuf	n1-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Bertenyoł, keč’ qˤaƛoƛin, boc’ä ʕomoyq harizi rodin.
Translated_Text: On the marriage, the wolves asked the donkey: "Sing a song!"
Russian_Translation: На свадьбе волк попросил осла петь песню.
Part_of_Speech: n3-nsuf	n3	v-vsuf-suf	n3pl-nsuf	n3-nsuf	comp	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Nełagon žedaƛ’ortow kurno, sosi meža qˤaƛoƛin.
Translated_Text: But he threw it back at them: "You sing [one] first!"
Russian_Translation: А он бросил на них, сначала сами пойте мол.
Part_of_Speech: pron-nsuf-suf	pron-nsuf-suf	v-vsuf	adv	pron-nsuf	v-vsuf-suf

Primary_Text: Boc’ä keč’ qˤaƛa baybik bodin, dalay, dalay sida bogmor ʕomoy, dalay, dalay sidagon bogmor mamalay, sidenigon bogmor k’et’un, mešinƛin.
Translated_Text: The wolves began to sing a song: "Dalay, dalay, a donkey for one meal; dalay, dalay, a rooster for another meal; and a cat and a calf for yet another meal."
Russian_Translation: Волк начал петь песню, далай, далай на одно кушанье осел, далай, далай, на другое кушанье петух, на третье кушанье кошка и теленок.
Part_of_Speech: n3pl-nsuf	n3	v-vsuf	comp	pref-v-vsuf	excl	excl	num	n3-nsuf	n3	excl	excl	num-suf	n3-nsuf	n3	adj-suf	n3-nsuf	n3-suf	n3-suf-suf

Primary_Text: Žedaqaytow keč’ qˤaƛa roži ʕomoyr teƛno, dimbi-dambar sis boc’i buygon bexursi, dimbi-dambar rik’i rezu madazar, dimbi-dambar qˤašizaƛ’orgon ƛäxurunin rexuranƛin.
Translated_Text: Then they gave the donkey the word to sing a song: "Dimbi-dambar, we really killed a wolf; dimbi-dambar, go outside and look; dimbi-dambar, by dawn we'll kill the rest."
Russian_Translation: После них песню петь слово дали ослу, димби-дамбар, убили одного волка,  димби-дамбар идите на улицу, посмотрите, димби-дамбар до рассвета убьем и остальных.
Part_of_Speech: pron-nsuf-suf	n3	v-vsuf	n4	n3-nsuf	v-vsuf	excl	num	n3	pref-adv-suf	pref-v-vsuf	excl	pref-v	pref-v	n2-nsuf	excl	v-vsuf-suf	v-vsuf-suf-suf	pref-v-vsuf-suf

Primary_Text: Boc’a rigtow rˤuƛ’no.
Translated_Text: The wolves were very afraid.
Russian_Translation: Волки сильно напугались.
Part_of_Speech: n3pl	pref-adv-suf	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Enduräza rik’in tamadaqorno eƛin, äƛiruxorno bexurna yizä boc’iƛin, žedułäy sis bezanix madaɣor bik’in.
Translated_Text: They went that way and said to the toastmaster: "[???]"; one of them went outside to took whether they had killed the wolf as they said.
Russian_Translation: Незаметно пошли и сказали тамаде, на самом деле они убили волка, мол, и один из них вышел на улицу, чтобы посмотреть.
Part_of_Speech: adv-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf	n-nsuf-suf	v-vsuf	v-vsuf-nsuf-suf	pref-v-vsuf	pron-nsuf	n3-suf	pron-nsuf	num	pref-v-deriv-nsuf	n2-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Elo ʕomoyä bayäruni bexasi boc’i bukaynosi, nasin boc’a elin rexar yizäƛin, aɣˤʷa tełäy roxin.
Translated_Text: When they saw the dead wolf that the donkey had brought, all the wolves said: "They will kill us!", ran out of the mill and away.
Russian_Translation: Когда они увидели там привезенного ослом убитого волка,  все волки убежали из мельницы, нас тоже они убьют мол.
Part_of_Speech: adv	n3-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf-suf	pref-v-vsuf	n3	pref-v-vsuf	adj	n3pl	pron-suf	pref-v	pron-nsuf-suf	n2-nsuf	post-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Elur yiłaƛ’ay mustaħiq’aw močin bäsunč’i, ži eƛnoqor ħadur roqanix zamanno bayn, howt’otow ričanƛin, žedas ħukmu boqno.
Translated_Text: "We won't find a place more suitable than this one; now the time has come to prepare for the winter; we will live here." was their decision.
Russian_Translation: Они решили остаться там же, подходящее чем это место мы не найдем и пришло время готовиться к зиме мол.
Part_of_Speech: pron-nsuf	pron-nsuf	adj	n3-suf	pref-v-vsuf	adv	n2-nsuf	comp	pref-v-deriv-nsuf	n3-suf	pref-v-vsuf	adv-suf	pref-v-vsuf-suf	pron-nsuf	n3	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: K’et’a eƛin, di ħon-mˤalizaƛ’no, mečozałno awbi riqirxo baħnayx bäčiƛin.
Translated_Text: The cat said: "I'll be walking around catching mice on the pastures and fields."
Russian_Translation: Кошка сказала, я по горам и долинам буду ходить, и ловить мышей мол.
Part_of_Speech: n3-nsuf	v-vsuf	pron	n2-nsuf-nsuf-suf	n3-nsuf-nsuf-suf	n3-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf	pref-v-vsuf	pref-v-suf

Primary_Text: Mamalayägon, di rešonazałäy šebin rut’ix bäčiƛin, eƛin.
Translated_Text: The rooster then said: "I will be collecting things out of the garbage."
Russian_Translation: А петух сказал, я из мусора вещи буду подобрать мол.
Part_of_Speech: n3-nsuf-suf	pron	n4-nsuf-nsuf	n4	pref-v-vsuf	pref-v-suf	v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Xizaɣor ʕomoyn mešin gurow reynoynanu.
Translated_Text: Finally, only the donkey and the calf were working.
Russian_Translation: В конце концов, работали только осел и теленок.
Part_of_Speech: adv	n3-suf	n3-suf	post	pref-v-vsuf-vsuf

Primary_Text: Rok’ƛ’o anuzaytow, yayn eƛni c’oxno, yegirno isi, rizin roč’i.
Translated_Text: Suddenly, the winter came and sent snow, and frost came.
Russian_Translation: Вдруг пришла зима, выпал снег, поднялись заморозки.
Part_of_Speech: n4-nsuf	v-vsuf-suf	pref-v-vsuf	n2	v-vsuf	pref-v-vsuf	n2	pref-v-vsuf	n4

Primary_Text: Madaħ siskin rac’-xana šebin ƛexunanu.
Translated_Text: Outside nothing remained to glut oneself with.
Russian_Translation: На улице нечего было есть-кушать.
Part_of_Speech: adv	pron	pref-v-vsuf	n4	v-vsuf-vsuf

Primary_Text: ʕOmoyn, mešin yołi tełxorno riħun, eƛnoqor rutäruni bix tatanaxorno roqno rac’xo zown.
Translated_Text: The donkey and the calf, however, sat down inside in the warmth and ate the hay that had been gathered for the winter.
Russian_Translation: А осел и теленок, укрывшись в теплом местечке, ели сено, собранное на зиму.
Part_of_Speech: n3-suf	n3-suf	adv	adv-nsuf-suf	pref-v-vsuf	n2-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf-suf	n4	n-nsuf-suf	pref-v-vsuf	pref-v-vsuf	v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Zamanałäygon k’et’un mamalayn roč’ä ɣˤila rižinosi, aɣˤuz ac-madaxorno rayn, elin regir tełxorƛin harizi roqno.
Translated_Text: After a while, when the frost began to disturb the cat and the rooster, they came to the mill's door and begged: "Let us inside!"
Russian_Translation: Через некоторое время, когда холод начал беспокоить кошку и петуха, подошли к двери мельницы и просили, пустите нас вовнутрь мол.
Part_of_Speech: n3-nsuf-suf	n3-suf	n3-suf	n4-nsuf	n4	pref-v-vsuf	n2-nsuf	n4-nsuf-suf	pref-v-vsuf	pron-suf	pref-v	adv-nsuf-suf	comp	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Sosisi ʕomoyn, mešin ričäsi zown regirxanuƛin, mežan ela riłetow eƛnoqor ħadurłi roda yałiƛin.
Translated_Text: At first, the donkey and the calf remained not letting them in: "You must as well, just like us, make preparation for the winter!"
Russian_Translation: Вначале осел, и петух упорно стояли, не пропустим, вам тоже, как и нам, нужно было готовиться к зиме мол.
Part_of_Speech: adv-suf	n3-suf	n3-suf	pref-v-vsuf	v-vsuf	pref-v-vsuf-vsuf-suf	pron-nsuf-suf	pron-nsuf	pref-conj-suf	n2-nsuf	n4	pref-v-vsuf	conj-suf

Primary_Text: Xizyogon nece čeranayzaƛ’, žedux rok’un rexun, regirno.
Translated_Text: Then they begged so much that the others pittied them and let them in.
Russian_Translation: Затем, пожалели их, раз столько просили, и пустили.
Part_of_Speech: adv	adv	v-vsuf	pron-nsuf	n4-suf	pref-v-vsuf	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Mamalayrno k’et’urno xizyo bič’zi roqno, reynoyn gurow žedar rac’-xana šebin riqixanusi yałrułi.
Translated_Text: The rooster and the cat then understood that it is only through work that one gets things to eat.
Russian_Translation: Петух и кошка потом поняли, что только трудом можно добивать есть-кушать.
Part_of_Speech: n3-nsuf-suf	n3-nsuf-suf	adv	n3	pref-v-vsuf	pref-v-vsuf	post	pron-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf	n4	pref-v-vsuf	v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Nełƛ’ay soder nasin žedu cołizin roqno reyno-rizix zown.
Translated_Text: After that, they all worked together.
Russian_Translation: С тех пор они согласовано вместе работали.
Part_of_Speech: pron-nsuf	post	adj	pron	comp-suf	pref-v-vsuf	pref-v-vsuf	v-vsuf

Primary_Text: K’uruč’ k’eč’ ɣudi rocu, buq bay.
Translated_Text: All's well that ends well.
Russian_Translation: Куруч, бусинка, пусть день проясняется, солнце восходит!
Part_of_Speech: n	n4	n4	pref-v	n3	pref-v

Primary_Text: Zownƛax zownanuƛax sis bečedaw žek’u.
Translated_Text: Once upon a time there was a rich man.
Russian_Translation: Был, говорят, не был один богатый человек.
Part_of_Speech: v-vsuf-suf	v-vsuf-vsuf-suf	num	adj	n1

Primary_Text: Nesis łˤono uži zown.
Translated_Text: He had three sons.
Russian_Translation: У него было три сына.
Part_of_Speech: pron-nsuf	num	n1	v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Užibi baq’ˤiłnosi babiya eƛin, howži mežur barubi rowa mixno bays, meža hemeł guħƛ’orno bizin c’eruc’abi kuro.
Translated_Text: When the sons grew up, the father said: "Now the time has come that you marry wives; climb on this hill and shoot with your bows.
Russian_Translation: Когда сыновья стали взрослыми, отец сказал, теперь настало вам время жениться, вы поднимитесь на ту горку и стреляйте из лука.
Part_of_Speech: n1-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf	n3-nsuf	v-vsuf	adv	pron-nsuf	n2-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf	n3-suf	pref-v-vsuf	pron-nsuf	pron	n3-nsuf-suf	pref-v-vsuf	n4-nsuf	v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Łaz ƛ’ˤuƛ’o c’eruc’a c’oxxo, hemeła ɣˤutkay kid yowa yołƛin.
Translated_Text: Whose roof you hit with the bow, the daughter from that house you will marry.
Russian_Translation: На чью крышу стрела упадет, из того дома и девушку возьмем мол.
Part_of_Speech: pron-nsuf	n3-nsuf	n4	v-vsuf	pron	n4-nsuf	n2	pref-v-vsuf	v-suf

Primary_Text: Guħƛ’orno bizin, łˤoran esnaza kurno c’eruc’a.
Translated_Text: The three brothers climbed up the hill and shot with their bows.
Russian_Translation: Поднялись на горку и трое братьев выстрелили из лука.
Part_of_Speech: n3-nsuf-suf	pref-v-vsuf	num-suf	n1-nsuf-nsuf	v-vsuf	n4

Primary_Text: Bežet’ani esnazas c’eruc’abi č’aq’ˤin žedu biłetow bečedawt’anizas ɣutkozas ƛ’ˤazaƛ’.
Translated_Text: The elder brothers' bows hit the roofs of houses of wealthy ones just like them.
Russian_Translation: У старших братьев стрела попала на крышу таких же богатых людей, как и они.
Part_of_Speech: pref-adj-suf-suf	n1-nsuf-nsuf	n4-nsuf	v-vsuf	pron	pref-conj-suf	adj-suf-suf-nsuf-nsuf	n4-nsuf-nsuf	n3-nsuf-nsuf

Primary_Text: Eɣeni esiws c’eruc’a resatow resux zownanu.
Translated_Text: The younger brother's bow didn't find anything at all.
Russian_Translation: Стрелу младшего брата никак не могли найти.
Part_of_Speech: adj-suf	n1-nsuf	n4	pref-v-vsuf-suf	pref-v-vsuf	v-vsuf-vsuf

Primary_Text: Babiya esirxo zown, žin c’eruc’a resunč’aƛin.
Translated_Text: The father was asking: "Didn't your bow find anything again?"
Russian_Translation: Отец спрашивал, еще не нашел что ли стрелу.
Part_of_Speech: n3-nsuf	v-vsuf	v-vsuf	adv	n4	pref-v-vsuf-suf-suf

Primary_Text: Uyra-łera ɣudƛ’aza c’eruc’a k’eda biħunosi, raładyoz lilyox sida ɣˤulade puħo eɣeni esiwrtow resun.
Translated_Text: After searching his bow for four or five days, the younger brother found it next to a stone at the sea shore.
Russian_Translation: Через четыре-пять дней начали искать, и нашел сам младший брат возле камня на берегу моря.
Part_of_Speech: num	n4-nsuf	n4	v-vsuf	pref-v-vsuf	n3-nsuf	n3-nsuf	num	n2-nsuf	n3-nsuf	adj-suf	n1-nsuf-suf	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: C’eruc’an rown yeda nexƛ’orey, xizaz bet’u-k’oƛix łoħron nexxo zown.
Translated_Text: He got his bow and while he came [back], a frog was hopping behind him.
Russian_Translation: Когда он со стрелой шел, подпрыгивая сзади, шла лягушка.
Part_of_Speech: n4-suf	pref-v-vsuf	pron	v-vsuf	adv	pref-v-vsuf	n3-suf	v-vsuf	v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Yedugon šebi t’o roqxoƛin tamaša oqno ƛexun ža.
Translated_Text: "What's happening here?", he stood there astonished.
Russian_Translation: Это что же здесь происходит, удивился он.
Part_of_Speech: pron-suf	pron	adv	pref-v-vsuf-suf	comp	v-vsuf	v-vsuf	pron

Primary_Text: Ayn babiw eɣeni žader, žin resunč’a c’eruc’aƛin.
Translated_Text: The father came to his young son[ and asked]: "Did you find your bow again?"
Russian_Translation: Отец пришел к младшему сыну, не нашел что ли еще мол.
Part_of_Speech: v-vsuf	n1	adj-suf	n1-nsuf	adv	pref-v-vsuf-suf	n4-suf

Primary_Text: Raładyoz lilyox c’eruc’an resus, howža łoħron xizaz nexsiƛin, žawab teƛno žoyä babiwr.
Translated_Text: "I found the bow at the sea shore, [and] that frog came behind me.", the son answered the father.
Russian_Translation: На берегу моря нашел стрелу, и та лягушка тоже шла сзади мол, ответил сын отцу.
Part_of_Speech: n3-nsuf	n3-nsuf	n4-suf	pref-v-vsuf	pron	n3-suf	adv	v-vsuf-suf	n3	v-vsuf	n1-nsuf	n1-nsuf

Primary_Text: Howži roda šebin anu, Allahä näƛru łinaƛ’no razi boqa bay eliƛin, eƛin babiya.
Translated_Text: "Now there's nothing to do about it, we have to accept what God has given to us," said the father.
Russian_Translation: Теперь делать нечего, мы должны согласиться тому, что Аллах дал нам мол, сказал отец.
Part_of_Speech: adv	pref-v-vsuf	n4	v	n1-nsuf	v-vsuf	pron-nsuf-suf	comp	pref-v-vsuf	pref-v	pron-suf	v-vsuf	n3-nsuf

Primary_Text: Eɣeni esiyan, łoħran sadaq ʕumru boda baybik bodin.
Translated_Text: The younger brother and the frog began to live together.
Russian_Translation: Младший брат и лягушка начали вместе жить.
Part_of_Speech: adj-suf	n1-nsuf-suf	n3-nsuf-suf	adv	n3	pref-v-vsuf	comp	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Sida quł madaħazay yeda ayzaƛ’or šet’ur bac’ad rodäsi ɣˤutku resun.
Translated_Text: One day, when he came from outside, he found the house all cleaned everywhere.
Russian_Translation: В один день, пока он с улицы возвращался, всюду дома нашел чисто.
Part_of_Speech: num	n4-nsuf	adv-nsuf	pron	v-vsuf	adv	comp	pref-v-vsuf	n4	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Tamaša oqno ƛexun eɣeni esiw, łuey yedu t’o idu nediw bercinłi rodisƛin.
Translated_Text: The younger brother got very surprised: "Who the heck has done such a beauty here at home?"
Russian_Translation: Младший брат удивился, кто же тут дома сделал такую красоту мол.
Part_of_Speech: comp	v-vsuf	v-vsuf	adj-suf	n1	pron-suf	pron	adv	adv	pron	n4	pref-v-vsuf-suf

Primary_Text: Q’ˤano äƛiru ɣudƛ’ogon yeda ayzaƛ’or resun istowliƛ’ riguƛ’ay rigu biša eqräsi.
Translated_Text: On the second day then, when he came, he found the richest food put on the table.
Russian_Translation: На второй день пока он не вернулся, нашел поставленные на столе лучшие из лучших яства.
Part_of_Speech: num	v-vsuf	n4-nsuf-suf	pron	v-vsuf	pref-v-vsuf	n4-nsuf	pref-adj-nsuf	pref-adj	n4	v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Hoboyƛa yedu bišʷa ħadur radiru žek’u iyrinč’ey xecač’inƛin, oqno yeda uži.
Translated_Text: "Now I will find out the man who has prepared this food," began the boy.
Russian_Translation: Теперь-то узнаю человека, который готовил эту пищу мол, начал это юноша.
Part_of_Speech: adv-nsuf	pron	n4	comp	pref-v-vsuf	n1	v-vsuf	v-vsuf-suf	v-vsuf	pron	n1

Primary_Text: Maħor äk’irusno rodin, acxazay ezun ičin.
Translated_Text: He did as if he went outside and looked behind the door.
Russian_Translation: Притворялся, что вышел на улицу и смотрел за дверью.
Part_of_Speech: adv	v-vsuf-nsuf-suf	pref-v-vsuf	n2-nsuf	v-vsuf	v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Taxƛäzayn boƛixno, yisiłtow adäza łoħra ƛ’iräy qalno kurno, tełäzay bercinaw kid yoƛixno.
Translated_Text: From the ottoman, that frog appeared, teared off his skin and a beautiful girl appeared.
Russian_Translation: Из-под кровати вышла лягушка, перед ним же скинула с себя кожу и изнутри появилась красивая девушка.
Part_of_Speech: n4-nsuf-suf	pref-v-vsuf	pron-nsuf-suf	post	n3-nsuf	adv	n3-suf	v-vsuf	adv-nsuf	adj	n2	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Ža nediw tamašałi rukaynosi, acno yaɣˤin, idurno ik’in, pečmaɣor łoħros qal kurno.
Translated_Text: Having seen such a wonder, he opened the door, went home and threw the frog's skin into the oven.
Russian_Translation: Увидев такое чудо, открыл дверь, зашел домой и бросил в печь кожу лягушки.
Part_of_Speech: pron	pron	n4	pref-v-vsuf	n2-suf	pref-v-vsuf	adv-nsuf-suf	v-vsuf	n3-nsuf	n3-nsuf	n3	v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Neł mixƛ’o kidbä eƛin, debeztow žukzar ža mi qal c’idaɣor kursiƛin.
Translated_Text: At that time the girl said: "You threw the skin into the oven to spite [me]!"
Russian_Translation: Тогда девушка сказала, себе во вред ты бросил кожу в печь мол.
Part_of_Speech: pron	adv	n2-nsuf	v-vsuf	pron-nsuf-suf	adv	pron	pron	n3	n4-nsuf	v-vsuf-suf

Primary_Text: Hemedur sadaq ʕumru bodix zown eɣeni užän, łoħrołäy yaqruni bercinawni kidbän.
Translated_Text: So the young boy and the beautiful girl that became of the frog were living together.
Russian_Translation: Таким образом, вместе жили младший сын и красивая девушка, которая превратилась из лягушки.
Part_of_Speech: adv	adv	n3	pref-v-vsuf	v-vsuf	adj-suf	n1-nsuf-suf	n3-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf-suf	adj-suf	n2-nsuf-suf

Primary_Text: Sida quł yizider babiw ayn.
Translated_Text: One day, the father came to them.
Russian_Translation: В один день к ним зашел отец.
Part_of_Speech: num	n4-nsuf	pron-nsuf	n1	v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Žaz baruƛ’no ezun babiws ʕuraw rok’u ƛexun.
Translated_Text: The father looked at the boy's wife and became very envious.
Russian_Translation: Глядя на жену сына, отец очень завидовал.
Part_of_Speech: n1-nsuf	n2-nsuf-suf	v-vsuf	n1-nsuf	adv	n4	v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Babiya sida quł uži idurno goƛ’in eƛin, howła ʕaƛor ʕuraw k’udi bayrinč’inäy, mi di exura yołƛin.
Translated_Text: The father one day invited the son to his home and said: "If [you] don't bring many vines to that village, I will kill you."
Russian_Translation: Однажды отец пригласил сына домой и сказал, я тебя убью, если ты не достанешь достаточно для села виноград.
Part_of_Speech: n3-nsuf	num	n4-nsuf	n1	adv-nsuf-suf	v-vsuf	v-vsuf	pron	n3-nsuf	adv	n3	pref-v-vsuf-vsuf	pron	pron	v-vsuf	v-suf

Primary_Text: Idurno ayn wˤałer q’ˤimno kurno xediw ičizaq, bara esirno, šebi roqno.
Translated_Text: Because, when the husband came home with his head down, his wife asked: "What happened?
Russian_Translation: Когда муж пришел домой с опушенной головой, жена спросила, что случилось,
Part_of_Speech: adv-nsuf-suf	v-vsuf	adv-nsuf	n4-suf	v-vsuf	n1	v-vsuf	n2-nsuf	v-vsuf	pron	pref-v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Šida mi nece q’ʷaridno oqno ičäsiƛin.
Translated_Text: Why have you become so sad?"
Russian_Translation: почему ты настолько опечаленный мол.
Part_of_Speech: pron	pron	adv	n3-suf	v-vsuf	v-vsuf-suf

Primary_Text: Xediya eƛin, babiya däł adäza zaħmataw masala ersi.
Translated_Text: The husband said: "My father has put a difficult task before me.
Russian_Translation: Муж сказал, отец поставил передо мной тяжелую задачу.
Part_of_Speech: n1-nsuf	v-vsuf	n3-nsuf	pron-nsuf	post	adj	n3	v-vsuf

Primary_Text: ʕAƛor ʕeziyaw k’udi däq biqira bayxƛin.
Translated_Text: I must deliver enough vines to the village."
Russian_Translation: Мне приходится доставить виноград достаточно для села.
Part_of_Speech: n3-nsuf	adv	n3	pron-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf	pref-v-vsuf-suf

Primary_Text: Mi rasgi q’ʷarid aqnoƛin, eƛin bara, raładyoz raʕalłixorno ik’in sis qˤaƛu rodo mi, elay bitor roda rayxosi šebin debertow ray.
Translated_Text: "Don't be sad at all!", said his wife, "Go to the edge of the sea and give a shout, then will the thing come to you what you will have to do."
Russian_Translation: Ты нисколько не расстраивайся, сказала жена, ты иди к берегу моря и один раз кричи, а дальше сам узнаешь, что должен делать.
Part_of_Speech: pron	adv	n3	v-vsuf-suf	v-vsuf	n2-nsuf	n3-nsuf	n4-nsuf-suf	v-vsuf	num	n4	pref-v-vsuf	pron	adv-nsuf	adv	pref-v-vsuf	pref-v-vsuf	n4	pron-nsuf-suf	pref-v

Primary_Text: Raładyoz raʕalłixorno ik’in eɣeni žoyä qˤaƛu rak’run, yoƛixno k’oƛin sis ɣˤanabi.
Translated_Text: And when the young boy went to the edge of the sea and shouted, a woman appeared and jumped out.
Russian_Translation: Пошел к берегу моря младший сын и закричал, вдруг появилась одна женщина.
Part_of_Speech: n3-nsuf	n4-nsuf-suf	v-vsuf	adj-suf	n1-nsuf	n4	pref-v-vsuf	pref-v-vsuf	v-vsuf	num	n2

Primary_Text: Yiła esirno, šebi deber retinƛin.
Translated_Text: She asked: "What do you want?"
Russian_Translation: Она спросила, что ты хочешь мол.
Part_of_Speech: pron-nsuf	v-vsuf	pron	pron-nsuf	pref-v-vsuf-suf

Primary_Text: Eɣʷeni žoyä esin, łinas ħal yisiƛ’ yałrułi.
Translated_Text: The young boy told why he was in trouble.
Russian_Translation: Младший сын рассказал о том, что его мучает.
Part_of_Speech: adj-suf	n1-nsuf	v-vsuf	pron	n3	pron-nsuf	v-vsuf

Primary_Text: Raładyołxorno yiħun, muhumozas qotno ric’no yoƛixno eƛin, šibaw žek’uz akä sist’a muhu eqro, elay bitorsi debi ħalt’i anuƛin.
